Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Marita K
Reviews.Content: It was nice and friendly. The rooms were o.k.; clean and fine. the breakfast was good; and the staff was always friendly. We arrived late in the night and we had to leave early in the morning - no problem. We had o book a shutle taxi - no. problem. we paid 50 Euro for 4 persons from the airport to the hotel. Even after more than 1 hour waiting for our luggage - no problem. the taxi driver was still there. And no extra charges. We will book it again - next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: arzusan
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Rome. First time we stayed in Termini. It was more closer to the city center but it was not nice to stay. In the second time we stayed in San Giovanni it was more then I expected. We made early booking the price was good according to Italy. Easy to reach to city center with metro. The only bad thing was the noice of the train. The breakfast was also nice. Easily reachable from the Fiumicino airport with train , costs 8 €.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jodie H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights, arriving on 4.4.2012. To be honest, room was ok - clean and tidy, just what we expected. The only one disappointment was that the last two nights we could smell cigarettes smoke coming from other hotel rooms even thought we were staying on non-smoking floor. Bad I suppose this is bad habit from guests - not staff members fault. The reason why I would not return to this hotel/or recommend this hotel is very rude staff. When we spoke with them and needed some information, they didn't even look at us and just murmured the answer. Only one guy working at the reception was quite nice, he even smiled at us, I couldn't believe it - can't remember what he look like, younger. Other staff members were absolutely unhelpful, made us feel we are not welcome at the hotel. We couldn't wait to check-out, we were even scared to ask any question. The staff never welcomed us with ''good morning'' or ''good evening'' - not even in Italian language, which I don't find very friendly. One evening my husband went to get WiFi codes for the internet + he had to ask so many questions because the guy on the reception wasn't really communicating, he looked like he has got something more important to do instead of paying attention to his hotel guest. My husband was really annoyed by that behavior. On Easter Monday we went for a breakfast at 6.30 (breakfast was served from 6.30 from Mon-to Fri). That day was our last day at the hotel (thanks god), + we had early flight back to the UK. When we came downstairs for a breakfast, we were bit surprised that lights were still off, the staff just shouted at us ''Come back at 7!'' When we asked why the breakfast is not served from 6.30 they didn't answer back + were talking in Italian between each other, just no respect for hotel guests at all, so we went back to the reception not knowing what is happening. Than receptionist explained breakfast is served from 7 am because is bank holiday. Ok, fair enough, but please, put some sign on with this information next time, or even just a phone call to the hotel room would be very helpful. So we thought nothing else could happened to us, it wasn't really true - when we were checking out + paying final bill, the reception staff did not even say goodbye. They just passed us the bill and that was it. They did not even look at us, they did not pay any attention to us at all, not even word saying ''thank you for staying, hope you enjoyed your stay, safe journey home'' not even goodbye! We felt awful. This was our first wedding anniversary! They made us feel they don't want us there! I would never come back again + I don't wish this experience to anyone else!

Reviews.Title: “Freezing cold rooms and no help”
Reviews.Author: Colin T
Reviews.Content: Arrived today (10 April 2012). Room must be well below 10C, floor especially cold. Noticeably colder than outside temperature, due to rooms on 'dark' side of hotel. Told by management essentially it was too bad, they'd turned the heating off because it was summer and would not turn it on again or provide any in-room heating ("it's against the law"). Very unsympathetic and disdainful attitude. As I have a heart condition, poor circulation and diabetes cold is not good for me. Oh, and don't eat here. Made that mistake at lunchtime. Not again. To be fair, clean and reasonable sized room and bed, altho shower is cramped. Very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Typical Holiday Inn Express.”
Reviews.Author: fresh0206
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was awful not just because of the filthy room but the service given by the front desk. Unfortunately, instead of getting a lovely welcome the service I received during check in (the agent wearing black glasses who is balding) was just terrible I didn’t feel welcome and the hospitality is very bland. Also, when I needed direction and information they’ll completely brush off you can just truly feel he didn’t want to help you; it’s not like I was asking a million questions for crying out loud. If you’re tired having to answer question from tourists by all means find another job. As my experience proceeded, when I entered my room it was a horrifying experience I thought I was checking in a cheap motel and I am not exaggerating. The front door has a huge stain on the carpet, and the bathroom tiles have a lot of molds. It was disgusting! I would believe they have an inspector to check each room to make sure it’s clean and comfortable. Also, the bed was even missing a bed skirt and the bed is in bad condition. The location was not at the middle of city but 10 minutes away from Rome by taking the taxi and each way cost 12 to 15 euros. Near grocery stores and few restaurants, which is convenient. The only great thing I love and enjoyed about my experience with this property was the breakfast, hands down. There are many selections from pastry, cheese, drinks, and hot meals. Overall, my recommendation if you can spend a little more on your stay I would recommend to stay somewhere else. The location was good but not great. Room doesn’t have the company standards. Service is below average.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: Anna B
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel three nights for our city trip to Rome. Even though it's not right into the center of Rome it's okay for what we needed it for. To be honest: There were better and worse hotels in my life before. The Holiday Inn Express Rome was something in the middle. Our room was clean, the bed had a good size for two people and there was enough space to put our cases aside. As well as that there was a pretty large balcony and tv. I can't say something to the latter because we didn't use it. We weren't lucky and got a room in which we heard the arriving and departing trains from the train station Tuscolana. Because of that it was impossible to open the windows during the nighttime, so the room was all airless and uncomfortable. No good sleeping in there. Breakfast was good, except for the orange juice. If you want to reach the city by train and then go further to the sights you have two options. First there is a metro station within 10 minutes walk from the hotel, named Ponto Lungo, which takes you to Vatican City in short time. Secondly there is the already mentioned train station Tuscolana. From there we went to the historical center of Rome and it has a good rail connection to the airport which was a plus. It's 350 m from the hotel, a 5 minute walk. We didn't use the buses at all. All in all the Holiday Inn Express was okay but nothing special. Nevertheless it was a good starting point for our trip to Rome. If we come back we would stay there again but would definitely ask for a room which is not on the train side.

Reviews.Title: “March 2012”
Reviews.Author: valrieabd
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but clean. Hotel could be updated in common areas, but all in all nice place. Breakfast was good. I would stay again. Although not near center of town, transportation extremely easy to navigate and buses, trains and metro right near by. Front desk staff could be nicer, but were always helpful when questioned.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Glo F
Reviews.Content: The staff are extremely helpful. This location is convenient, bus stop is only a 5 min walk and it's amazing when the bus passes by the colliseum everyday. Hotel is clean and breakfast is very good. There is a supermarket around the corner. Perfect location if you're travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: comnen
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for 2 in advance with a very good price - 64 euro per night. Was afraid that would be nothing for that and also very far from the downtown. Nope! it is very conviniently located hotel (bus, metro, train. 40 minutes to Vatican, 25 minutes to Termini, 45 minutes to the airport), good spacious rooms (not less and even larger than in other HIE, quiet, though railway is not far), good breakfast. Business centre (printer, computer), internet exta (they charge 2 euro per 30 min unless you are platinum member). Surrounding are dull and there is nothing really, but if you use it a place to sleep - that is the very one

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: aysem_duygu
Reviews.Content: Rome hotels are generally very expensive, especially the ones near to the city center. So I chose Holiday Inn San Giovanni as an economic option. Holiday Inn hotels usually do not surprise, this was not an exception as well. Nothing special, but clean modest rooms. We booked a standart room and had a standart smallish room. Pros: -Room was clean. No problem with hot water. - We paid around 60 Euro for the room which is very reasonable when other hotels considered. - The breakfast is complimentary. There were enough choices as well. (a few types of cheese, jams, cereals, yoghurts. Coffee is good, fruit juice is bad) -Staff was helpful. -Coming from the airport is very easy. Just take the train from airport and get off in Tuscolana station. (ticket costs 8 Euro /person) -Bus stop is very near to the hotel like 5 minutes walk and no 85 takes you to the city center. (takes around 25 minutes to reach Colosseum) -The metro station Ponte Lungo is 10 minutes walk. You can reach Vatican directly with this line in 25 minutes. Cons: -It is a classic Holiday Inn Express, don't expect much. -The location is not fancy. (despite some other reviews, we did not have any safety concerns, it seemed a standart residential neighborhood) - It is not in the city center. - Yes, it is near to the railway station but sound of the trains did not bother us much. - There are not safe deposit boxes in the rooms. And Rome is not the best place to carry your valuable belongings with you. Safe deposit boxes are only in reception area. As a result, on a budget holiday for a 4 night stay, I'll always stay in this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hayescar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Quite a walk from the metro with cases and children. The area IS run down but hotel itself quite pleasant. Staff could have been more friendly but they were not rude. It is noisy but we thought the actual noise inside the hotel was worse than the nearby train station, because of the wood corridors. Take earplugs. We went on 3 tours and we were the only ones where the coaches wouldn't drop us back to our hotel because we were too far out. Would not stay here again purely because of location but the hotel was fine. A big thing to be aware of is the dog poo that is littered all down the streets from the hotel to the metro, the area is not clean full of litter, graffiti and dog poo!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tourmanager81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, new, pretty and confortable. Is not in Rome downtown but there is a metro stop near (15-20 min walk) and a bus stop for several lines just 5 min walking down the hotel. At the desk there are several people and they are all nice and helpfull. Rooms are big and clean,with all comforts. We booked several rooms there and none of us had any issue. Breakfast is great for Italy. Nothing to report. I would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Mold, Mildew, and lack of caring.”
Reviews.Author: TheFielding
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this is not the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. That award goes to the Mariner Inn in San Simeon, CA, USA. However this is the second worst hotel I've ever stayed at, and the worst outside of the US. The lower level staff were okay but everything else was subpar, especially management. No complaints on the normal breakfast either, I enjoyed the bread and cereal and hot drinks. Also the location isn't that bad as it's in a non-touristy area so you can go to local shops and purchase libations and snacks at non-inflated prices. It's also only a few blocks from two different Subway stations and a block from the train station. Watch out at the train station though, my friend was robbed with distraction technique when they tossed a mud mixture on us and pretended to help clean it up as someone else stole his bag. That's the complete list of the positives here and it clearly isn't very long or detailed. It's not long because there weren't many and it's not detailed because I wouldn't advise anyone to stay here and I'd like to use your time better to illuminate you on the issues this property suffers from. The real issue is the mold, mildew and disregard for the company privacy policy. Let's start with mold and mildew. The bathroom (especially the shower) in my first room had insane amounts of mold and mildew, and I put up with it for three days until IHG Twitter Care was able to force the staff to move me to a new room. The mold and mildew were just two of the problems in our first room. Others include; normal windows despite facing a major rail yard and train station, toilet so close to the wall it was nearly impossible to use, semen and other stains on the floor and walls, including one stain that I'm pretty sure was blood. Absolutely unacceptable at any price point. At no point did the hotel staff apologize for the mold or offer us anything other than a new room which they seemed to have been forced to do from corporate. They didn't even offer to help us move our stuff from one room to the other or even bring the new key to us, I had to go fetch it. There was clearly a general lack of caring. The new room had its share of problems as well. It had similar stains as the first one and also had mold and mildew in the shower, though not to the extent of the other room. This room however only had the Italian electrical outlets which are not like the ones used in the rest of Western Europe -- it is my understanding most Italian hotel rooms (including our first room) have at least one European outlet. This new room was near the street which was actually much quieter. The wood flooring in the hallway made for a lot of noise considering our new location right next to the elevator. These problems were bad but to me the most egregious issue of all was the re-use of pages with customer information for the "USA Times" and other quickie newspapers. The backs of these contained information about each guest including name, price paid, and room number. This is a clear privacy violation and extremely upsetting. I was travelling on a freely posted (by a VP at IHG) F&F rate but I still expected to at least get decent treatment and a clean room (really all I needed was a clean room with electricity) and I couldn't even get that. It's amazing to me how different my experience at this hotel was from the only other HI Express I've stayed at in Europe, the Rue d' Italy -- Paris location. I hope this review provides an insightful take on this establishment so others can see how it is.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Attention”
Reviews.Author: anotnioefa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from January 26 to January 31 and the service over all is really great, but there is nothing or none that matches service, attention, dedication and compromise with the client than SIMONE DI PORTO and ALESSANDRA COPPOCA, both of them really are committed and love what they do, always aware of what you need and willing to help you. ANd these review is coming from a long term priority club member with Platinum Status, besides the deco of the hotel and overall was good. Hope to go back to the same hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: Prayzur
Reviews.Content: This is coming from a long term Priority Club member who has stayed at Holiday Inns around the world.... This was my worst experience. Would you like to hear it? Here it is... I booked the hotel through Hotels.com for vacation with my wife and on arrival it seemed ok. The overall decor of the hotel seemed to be new, but renovated on a minimum budget. Our first room's TV did not work and as not clean. Hotel management moved us to another room. This was challenging as the front desk staff's English skills were not very good. Breakfast was to start at 7:00 and many were in line early to eat before leaving on our tours. Unfortunately the breakfast opened late (10 minutes) leaving little time to eat and clean up before meeting the 7:30 am bus. Finally the real problem. Because I used Hotels.com I paid in advance, had a receipt and verification. But when it came time to leave the front desk was stilled manned by the night shift who neither read, spoke nor understood English well. Thus I had to pay again for the stay. I did this as we were late to catch our plane and I assumed as a Priority Club Member I would be able to easily call their service center and have the fees reversed. I did not have time to argue with someone who did not understand what I was saying anyway. After escalating though the Priority Club and Holiday Inn service lines it took three months for my charges to be reversed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but......”
Reviews.Author: ronsrice
Reviews.Content: The Good: excellent complimentary breakfast with good hours. Decent size room (for Europe), good bedding, good bathroom. Not USA HI-E expectations but good. Internet access in room expensive but I was comp'd due to Priority Club status which I appreciated. Fixed price of 45 Euro to FCO excellent service in Mercedes sedan. "Close" to Metro, but be prepared to walk 3 solid blocks, one uphill. The Metro can get you easily near most tourist sites. Easy train from FCO with stop very close to hotel. I had seen (before we booked) some complaints about train noise. It is negligible and they do not run 11pm-7am. Suggest getting room furthest from tracks if very light sleeper. Was there 01/04-08. The Not-So-Good: Very few restaurants (or any good) within walking (2) so eat dinner in city. Area looks daunting but really isn't but is still a bit disconcerting. Front desk Staff is at best indifferent and inconsistent. On minute attentive, next minute almost dismissive. Weird. You must be in pretty good shape if you go back and forth to the Metro (more than 10 min per advertising). Probably not stay at this property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thejester82
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in the Holiday inn Express San Giovanni over the New year Period with my wife. The Hotel is very easy to reach from Fuimicino Airport as it is near the Train Station Tuscolana. The first impression was not very good because the streets are all full of graffiti and very dirty. Next door to the Hotel there is a shelter for homeless people but altough it is not a normal thing to have near a Hotel we never had any problems even late at night. The inside of the Hotel was a normal standard as any Holiday Inn and the Breakfast was very good and plenty of choice. Just make sure you go down early becasue there is limited space to sit down.The Hotel is 2 minutes walk from the Bus station going to the Centre of Rome and also close by to the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “The noisiest Holiday Inn ever”
Reviews.Author: rosielamb
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say this is the noisiest Holiday Inn I have ever stayed in - come to that the noisiest hotel! The trains do run ALL night - and sound their horns during the night. We stayed on the quad side of the hotel - heaven knows what it was like on the railway side. We also had music from the bar playing until around 1am in the morning across the quad - could not believe it - we stayed for several nights and it was the same each night.. Tried to ring down to reception but had no answer. There was only heating in the room - no aircon and when I asked for a fan I was told curtly they did not have any. We could not have the window open because of the train & music noise. On the upside - the hotel was near enough to the centre of town to walk in (please understand we are great walkers) or get the metro - one euro for 90 mins of travel - or you can buy a rail card to cover several days - we found the one euro tickets cheaper in the long run. Easy to get to from Fiumicino airport - 8 stops on the overground train - 8 euro's each way then a very short walk to hotel. Breakfast was lovely with hot & cold dishes. The hotel was clean - no problems there. Staff were helpful and spoke good english. Shops nearby - just under the railway bridge is a little supermarket (just up off the road - looks like a Lidl) where you can buy goods more cheaply than in town. Would definately NOT stay here again - slept for 14 hrs when I got home due to the sleep deprivation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DSouzaScarborough
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and the Breakfast is awesome. Hotel is located close to downtown and makes it easy to travel to all the sight seeing place. Rome is a city full of history, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DAVE_and_ADRIENNE
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, super friendly and helpful staff. We checked in early in the morning and were accommodated without charge. The breakfast was perfect. Make sure you get a few free cappuccino's from the Barista. The Nescafe machine is fine but the cappuccino's from the barrista (Coffee Bar) are better.

Reviews.Title: “Not the same as others in chain”
Reviews.Author: KathiC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was on the whole clean, bathroom needed redecorating, and well kept which gave a positive impression. We were checked in quickly and politely however disappointed when we found our room opened out onto the train tracks, the noise was an issue as we would have preferred to have a window open all the time however the sound was prohibitive. This meant our room was too hot for us and we did not sleep well at all. The breakfast was as per other hotels in the chain, the breakfast room kept tidy however restocking some of the food items could take a while (no bread on one morning for duration of our time breakfast time). The distance to the Metro line is walkable however there is a need to cross a very busy main road and it is not well signposted, so please ask at reception before venturing out. We used the Tuscolana to Fiumicino Airport train line on our departure and this was efficient and only $8 each, much cheaper than the taxi serviced offered by hotel. There is no tea/coffee tray in the room which is a first for us in this type of hotel and was really missed. There are two vending machines which were not always well stocked. The hotel is in a area where homeless people congregate in the evening, we saw a number when we returned to hotel between 6-7pm however whilst it can appear intimidating we did not incur any issues. If we returned to Rome, which is a city we really enjoyed, we probably would choose to stay nearer the city centre to eliminate the travel in and out.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base for visiting Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Supastar147
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights while visiting Rome. Located in the suburbs, only two minutes from Roma Tuscolana Train Station (5 minutes from Termini - Rome central train/bus) and 5 minutes from Metro Station. Staff gave the most friendliest and warm welcome, providing excellent and professional service, along with local information, maps and tourist information as part of chck-in. Breakfast was included in price and good value and could be taken in courtyard. Bedroom was excellent. Bed very comfortable and choice of pillows. I will definitely use this hotel if I ever travel to Rome and would certainly recommend it as an excellent base for tourists - a quiet haven after a day in a very busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay for European holiday.”
Reviews.Author: inetbas
Reviews.Content: Rome is an expensive city for hotels. For 80 euro a night and a few free nights this was perfect for our visit to Rome. This hotel was slightly outside the city center however the tuscolana train station and metro made connections from airport and city easy.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: The Free A
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Holiday Inn Express in Rome during vacations and here some information about this Hotel: The internet is not free, they charge you 30 minutes at 2,00 Euros / One Hour at 4 Euros / 3 Hours at 7 Euros / 24 Hours at 11 Euros and One week at 40, 00 Euros They have only 10 Safe Deposit Boxes for the whole Hotel and it's kind of hard to get one.. MY PROS AND CONS… PROS: This Hotel is convenience located close to train station Roma Tuscolana ( the one that you take from Fumiccino Airport to Rome) and Ponte Lungo Subway Station. The Breakfast Buffet is included in the rate and, is very good; with different options of food, the schedule for the Breakfast is really convenience, but I will tell you to get earlier in order to get a spot cause sometimes it’s gets crowed.The people that work at the Restaurant are very helpful and courteous. There is a nice courtyard off the lobby and breakfast area. The area is safe (it’s a neighborhood area) so, you will find supermarkets and pharmacies nearby…Rooms are cozy, clean and decent (except for mine that had a leak in the ceiling) , the housekeeping are very courteous and helpful too..If you want to stay for a week I will recommend you to buy a 16 Euros Ticket that is unlimited and you can use to ride the trains and buses ( You can buy it at any store that it has a big “T” sign). The Bus 85 ( which pass close to the Hotel) can take you through Via Appia to the Colisseum and The Trevi Fountain.. Avoid to eat in this Restaurant “PASTARINO” ( it’s close to the Hotel) it’s overprized and the service and food are not really good… CONS: Well I can say that my experience with the Front Desk Staff was not really pleasant, they practically “try” to ruin my stay here with their rudeness and lack of Hospitality…My check in was done by Giselle ( who’s not a friendly person), it was so plain and bored…the staff barely speaks English and it’s kind of hard to understand them… As soon I get the keys I went to my room and I noticed that the desk lamp was burned out, I reported and nothing was done… During my stay wanted to get a copy of my bill to see how the charges were going, and the Front Desk Agent (I barely remember his name….I think is Gianpaolo or Giovanni..Something like that) refused to provide the copy that I was asking, all that he kept saying it was “ It’s impossible”..???..How hard or impossible is to print out a single copy of a guest’s bill…He said that I will get the copy of the bill at the check out..but ..“HELLO” I wanted to copy of the bill before my check out to check my balance..This guy started arguing with me and he had the nuts to say “ I don’t know what’s your problem..You don’t believe me”….Excuse me??...I didn’t have any problem and I didn’t say that I didn’t believe you, it’s YOU the one that has a problem!!!...after a long argument he ended up printing out the copy of the bill… At check out wanted to speak with the Front Desk Manager and after I told him about the incident that I had.. he said that “ Well everyone has a bad day”…Well… let me tell you this..In the Hospitality Industry when you work with Guests and Customers and, if you are having a bad day or going through a tough situation, the guest doesn’t need to take your frustration or your problems, whatever you are going through it’s better to leave it in your locker room or in your house..But don’t take it to the guests..Is not professional… Will stay here again??..May be...

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: BenDSM
Reviews.Content: This is an o.k. hotel, but nothing special. We used points, so can't complain too much. Note that this is not a City-Center hotel, so the tours will not do a complimentary pick-up from here. We used a taxi to get to City-Center for about 15 Euro. This is not like a typical Holiday Inn Express in the U.S. One bright spot...the staff helped us arrange a taxi from the airport to the hotel. Our taxi driver was waiting for us right outside the baggage claim area with a sign holding up our name. That was quite nice after traveling for 20 hours! This was all arranged by email with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for budget holiday”
Reviews.Author: Britsonhol
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the room good, overlooking the courtyard. Lack of tea or coffee making facilities in the room was a shame. The breakfast was average although the fruit juice had certainly never seen any real fruit! Location ok. Bit tatty, but we found graffiti and untidiness to be a feature of Rome generally. The hotel does do snacks if you want to eat in, but there are two REALLY good restaurants very close. To get to them you turn left out of the hotel and take the first right. At the end of that street (nor far at all) is a lovely restaurant 'Ristorante Sacco'. We had a delightful meal there and they clearly also do take out pizzas. The food itself is fairly nouvelle cuisine and very good. The other restaurant, which we didn't try, although that too was recommended was a Sardinian one just opposite the side road. The 3 day pass from the kiosk at the end of the road is a great idea and the bus and metro take you to all the places you need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, black mold in the shower.”
Reviews.Author: Metoyou09
Reviews.Content: Having stayin in other Holiday Inns during our trip, we were expecting good things from the one that we booked in Rome. However, we were sadly disappointed. The proximity to the metro station is not convenient, expecially after a long day of walking, it is a long walk back to the hotel (that being said, Rome's metro system is a disappointment in and of itself). As for the hotel, the whole floor that we were on smelled like smoke, The shower in our room, as well as in the room of our parents, was full of black mold. The walls in the room were all marked up and it looked like gum had been stuck on the wall. While I once had confidence in the Holiday Inn name, I will be cautious to book with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location but decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin B
Reviews.Content: The location was bad because it looked very lonely and dangerous for a traveler. We found it hard to find, because it's pretty far from the metro (Furio Camillo station, about 700 meters). The room was normal, bed was fine and king-sized, bathroom was good. We could listen to the trains outside, but if you get to the hotel after a long day of walking, you won't notice that noise on the moment you lay on the bed to rest. Did not include free wi-fi access (Roma was a place were a free hotspot was hard to find). We had to pay 4.00 EUR for an hour of access. At the check out they carged us 2.00 EUR per person per day because of a "city tax". The hotel had a private taxi service, we had to buy the service (50.00 EUR to Fiumicino airport) because we needed to get to the airport by 05.00 am. That service was great, it was a very nice taxi (Mercedes Benz E-class)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!!”
Reviews.Author: laura22204
Reviews.Content: Nicely outfitted!! Great breakfast!! Bring earplugs to guard against train noise. Bus 85 goes to the forum. Get tickets at any tobacco store and validate in the machine on the bus; people will help you. At bottom of street are good places to eat. Directly across is good for pasta, etc. (carryout ok). Turn left and find a local pizza place. Good for snacking. Keep walking left a few blocks and find what looks like a supermarket but is actually a buffet with all kinds of yummy foods, including grilled chicken. You can pick a bottle of wine right there and eat in the shop at the tables provided there. Lots of local traffic. Cheap. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: obsessivetraveler
Reviews.Content: We really weren't expecting much from the Holiday Inn Express, but were pleasantly surprised by helpful front desk employees, convenient 24 hr. bar, clean large rooms and adequate breakfast buffet. The walk to the metro was a bit further than we were expecting, but we were able to get every where we wanted to go. Did not spend a lot of time in the neighborhood, as we were touring historical sites most of our time in Rome, but the area seemed safe and was quiet. Rooms were clean, and bathroom was adequately sized. We may try and find a hotel a little closer to city center on our next trip to Rome, but were certainly not disappointed by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LadyWisteria
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express is not one I would recommend for people going to Rome for a vacation. The reception staff is not friendly nor overly helpful. The location is not central to anything and it located right next to the train yard, so there is train noise all through the night. The metro underground station is about 4 blocks away and there is no complimentary transportation nor bellman service. The corridor hallway walls are void of any decoration or pictures and the hallway floors either haven't been washed in a long time or have puddles of water condensation from the overhead air conditioning units. The free breakfast is above average, but do be careful as if they make a cappacino or speciality hot drink, you will be charged! You are charged for internet service and there is a minimal business center (one desktop PC and printer). We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary, Ordinary, Ordinary.”
Reviews.Author: Abanazar
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 4 nights and won't be back. The worst H.I. we've stayed in. Below expectation levels. Reception - slow. Bedroom - ordinary. Bathroom - OK, but shower unit well past its best. One public computer - so slow as to be useless. The whole place has a cheap feel to it. Priced above its level - should be 2*. Breakfast - greasy unevenly cooked bacon, the hardest bread we've ever come across & breakfast area layout not user friendly. Also, it's well out of the centre and so buses/metro needs to be used to go anywhere. Immediate area a bit scruffy, downmarket with (like most of Rome, no Italy in general) loads of graffiti. The hotel has a courtyard area where it's possible to have an evening drink or snack and can be used for breakfast which is pleasant - but the courtyard area is crying out for a swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is included in the rate”
Reviews.Author: cottoneyejo
Reviews.Content: Advantage of staying with Holiday Inn Express. 1. Breakfast Included. 2. Assurance of a company like IHG. i.e standards are maintained. 3. Reasonable pricing. 4. Doesnot have extra frills but is perfect for city breaks. 5. Plenty of Express around Europe to choose from. San Giovanni, no different, clean efficient, effective, location- took a metro ride of 10-20 minutes to reach Colossium, Bus took half hour which are reasonable time in a capital city to reach the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: sarsonuk
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, location is way out town. Close to the bus but a pain. Rooms look like they were thrown together. Rooms are clean. Breakfast is very good with cooked bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good value.”
Reviews.Author: SteveB753
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in September 2011 with my young daughter and I in one room and my parents next door. Having adjoining rooms was fantastic as I was able to leave my daughter with my parents without having to take her to another part of the hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and had air con which in the heat of a Rome summer was fantastic. A small fridge in the room would have been a bonus as we had no way to keep water chilled etc. A special mention to the duty manager on the front desk, Simone. He was pleasant, helpful and efficient on every occasion we interacted with him and consistently went above and beyond including allowing us to check in early when we arrived at 8am after a very long flight from Oz. Breakfast was good and the location suitable for people who wish to stay near the city centre but not in it. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Safety at Risk”
Reviews.Author: DanASSET1
Reviews.Content: My wife, young adult daughter and son stayed at this hotel for three nights in August 2011. We also stayed at this hotel two years ago, and found it an excellent value, and as a result we returned for our stay in August 2011. What a difference two years makes! What was once a vibrant neighborhood with many restaurants in a busy working class environment has completely collapsed. Numerous homeless people sleep on the street, restaurants are vacant, and entire apartment complexes are deserted. My wife and daughter were actually afraid to walk to or from this hotel after dusk (my daughter has traveled throughout the world on her own, and this is the only hotel about which she has made such a comment. Therefore, I cannot recommend this hotel for those concerned about their personal safety (or for those who might care to dine in the area surrounding the hotel). On the positive side, the breakfast is quite nice. Note that this hotel is near a train station, so it can be very noisy. I stay at Holiday Inns (and their affiliated properties) over 50 nights per year, and although I am loyal to this chain, I cannot recommend this hotel, unless you are skilled in the martial arts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location, convinient to local transport”
Reviews.Author: Alaska-GLD-Member
Reviews.Content: At first, the reviews warned us that hotel location was not convenient and too far from city center. As we reached the place, it didn't seem that far from airport via taxi (cost 50 euros). The check in was quick and room was exactly as we booked it (for 3 adults, 3 beds). There are 2 train stations nearby. If you come from airport, you should get off at Tuscalano station (must not take non-stop to Termini from airport) which is about 4 min walk (downhill) to the hotel. You can also take metro from Termini (must take a train from airport to Termini) and get off at Furio Camillo with a 12 min walk to hotel (downhill). Puerto Lungo station is what other reviews recommended but it is confusing to get to from hotel (we used Puerto Lungo first but didn't again after we came to know Furio Camillo). There is also a great Pizza place named Magna Pizza that had the best pizza I have ever tested (we went there 4 times during our 5 day stay in Rome and my teenager loved it). They had this giant pizza for just 11 euros that fed 3 adults and still had left over. A great ice cream place is also next door to the pizza joint. Hotel also had a open space lounge area within the facility where you can hang out at night and have beer. It's outside so you dont have to worry about kids making noise etc. This hotel and the surrounding area made our stay very pleasant. Free breakfast was great but they didn't offer internet for free instead 10 euros a day which includes all pay per view movies. If we ever go back, I am certainly going back to this hotel and will have more appreciation for what it offers. It is away from tourist crowd and give you a real view of living in Rome from local perceptive. Hope this helps clear some of the reviews that made us think twice before we booked it. But we are glad we did. It was so much better than anticipated and exceed our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tagami46
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel! we stayed 4 nights around the the end of April month, the rooms are very clean and neat. it is located in via asisi, wich is about 15-20 minutes walk and metro ride till you get to termini station.( the closest metro station is ponte lungo- which is about 2 blocks from there). the shower is very large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Gussy
Reviews.Content: We only stayed two nights and didn't have any issues. Used points. Husband travels for a living and I use to. I emailed hotel and they secured a reservation at the Galleria Borghese and was informed that the hotel would store our luggage. We took them up on this since we wanted to visit the Vatican in the AM before departing for a cruise. There is a bar area on the right of the lobby if you want a drink, decent lobby area and breakfast area. We stayed on the second floor with a balcony that I requested via email. I took ear plugged because I read the noise from the trains were distracting but we never had any issues with noise. Furthermore, the employees were very helpful to us. There is also a pizza joint near the hotel that we really enjoyed but didn't like their wine. :( We purchased two Roma passes at the airport, took the regional train to the hotel and to the port (not included in the Roma pass), buses, metros, and visited Capitoline Museum and Galleria Borghese with the first two free attractions. Great views of Roman Forum/Coliseum from the Capitoline area... We didn't want to stay in the heart of the city and researched so everything met/exceeded our expectations. The metro and bus stations were nearby. We had a blast and would stay at this property again. The only negative that I can say is why have a balcony with no table and chairs? It would have been nice to sit down to relax/eat our pizza but hotel probably wants people to use the lobby or breakfast areas.

Reviews.Title: “Ok experience”
Reviews.Author: tapsa212
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, but permanent stains on the ceiling and walls. Good breakfast but only a couple of employees really customer friendly. Location ok, about 15 minutes by bus to The heart of The city. Price cheap so quite good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, clean and easy connections”
Reviews.Author: Catalan91
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 15 year old daughter for 5 days. I found the room to be clean with fresh towels each day and the staff to be both professional and helpful. The buffet breakfast was very good with a choice of both hot and cold dishes. There is no ice machine but staff at the bar will fill your ice bucket for you at no extra cost. Train from Fiumincino cost 8.50 one way and was easy and quick. The is a Pizza/ pasta restuarant in via Tuscolona opposite via Assisi and it was very good. Also, turn left from via Assisi in to via Tuscolona and about 400m further you will find a deli/ cafe that does roast chicken and fries or pizza with a drink starting at about 8.50 euros. The TV only shows Sky News, BBC News and CNN in English but there are the usual movies on demand if you want them. Internet was 2 euors for 30 mins:4 euros for an hour and other prices ending with 40 euros for a week. On leaving the station at Tuscolana there are two exits, one taking you to each side of via Tuscolana. Just make sure that you go under the bridge and via Assisi is 100m on your left. Don't worry about the area as previous reviews have mentioned, we were out at night and there were no problems whatsoever. Its easy to get into central Rome on the no 85 bus. Just buy a ticket from the kiosk at the bus stop at the bottom on the street and validate it on the bus. We bought the 24 hour pass for 4 euros each and it was good value. The bus can get quite busy in the morning so rather than validate it as soon as you get on you can wait till it empties or do it on another bus. The 85 takes you to the Colosseum and you can get connections from there. If you're going to the Vatican then stay on the 85 a couple of stops until Piazza Venezia from where you can get a no 46 which takes you to the Vatican. You will have to cross a couple of the roads going through the Piazza as the stop is on the far side. At the Colosseum beware of the "Roman soldiers", they will charge 10 euro for a photo after standing beside you and being all smiles, giving a sword and laurel crown to your children. They will back down if you argue with them but they can be persistent. Also, ensure that everyone have their shoulders and knees covered if you are visiting St Peters Basilica. They are very strict about the dress code for women in particular but it is a place of worship. Also, be wary of where you go to eat around the Vatican. One cafe charged 35 euros for 3 half paninis and 3 cokes. Go to one of the smaller take away shops in Borgo Vittorio where the same will cost you 15 euros! Overall, a great holiday with plenty of good memories.

Reviews.Title: “Average, slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: soumiunq
Reviews.Content: Coming from the Holiday Inn Express in Paris, this one was a bit of a disappointment. Room was clean and comfortable, but there were no coffee making facilities. The shower area was really very small. I banged my elbow quite a few times. Staff were a bit grumpy, not rude actually, but they didn't seem too friendly either. And it was more expensive than the Paris hotel, so not really value for money. The location was away from the city, but connections were not too bad. The Metro station Ponte Lungo was about a kilometre away and we learnt to our surprise that the Metro Line closes at 9 PM. However, bus no 85 provided a very convenient connection to wherever we wanted to go. The connection to the airport was also convenient with the Tuscolana station close by.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back because it seems they are not interests in looking after their guests”
Reviews.Author: Nanjingfoodieboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife on our honeymoon trip. One of the nights we came back from a long day walking and called front desk for sanitary items for my wife, was told they didn't have it and I had to call back the following morning. However on the sign in the bathroom it says "they would be more than happy to provide a replacement to the guest if they have forgotten to bring with them". I suggest the hotel management to take the sign off as it is only an empty promise that you can not deliver to your guests. The next morning I called and I got it, I am sure it was there and the overnight receptionist just simply didn't know where it was stored and where to get and he didn't even want to try to find out with his colleagues to solve the problem for the guest. I was very disappointed at this hotel to this extent. What I observed from this hotel was the staff didn't know how to smile, they seemed very cold and had no interests in greeting their guests. I will not come back and stay there again if there is no improvement for the future.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money but dont want to go back there again”
Reviews.Author: melbcollege
Reviews.Content: You pay what you get, it is a reasonable hotel if you can put with uninterested attitudes, distance from the city centre. the room is reasonable condition. breakfast is pretty average, the staff are unwilling to help, they are more interested to talk to each other. make sure you work out everything yourself. I booked airport transfer to this hotel, it was the best decision i made for Italy trip. unless you are really in tight budget, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with Excellent Breakfast Setup”
Reviews.Author: IslandCouple32
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 9AM from the intercity train line which was only a few hundred meters away, understandably we couldn't check in and were given keys to the storage room where we left our luggage, caught the subway into Rome, probably a 10-15 minute walk to the Metro station. After that we caught the bus (no. 85 I think) which was more convenient as it stopped at the bottom of the street and also went straight into Rome. Back to the hotel at 2PM and our rooms were ready, they were on the 2nd floor and were very modern, comfortable furniture and beds and no complaints, looked out into the courtyard. Breakfast was free downstairs and we were surprised by the variety and quality, we filled up on breakfast daily before heading into Rome and didn't need to eat for hours! Location quite suburban so not much to see around the area, however the public transport was convenient and reliable, front desk organized airport transfer by car which was prompt and efficient for our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Staff, Difficult Location”
Reviews.Author: slustooge
Reviews.Content: We arrived at noon and were denied early check in( I am a priority club platinum member which "guarantees" early check in). I was given a key to the storage closet and unescorted, I left our baggage among the others. We cut short our sight seeing to return at 5pm to check in and change clothes. Our bags had been moved, but nothing appeared to be missing. We were given a smoking room even though I had specifically booked a non smoking room. The room was quite small, on the ground floor with no windows, but a glass door that prevented airing out the room overnight. Hardwood floors on the ground floor make for noisy hallway. You can hear everything and everyone at all hours. Breakfast was free and better than expected. The hotel was not particularly close to the subway and not convenient to come and go during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: realnunes
Reviews.Content: As a young Brazilian couple we wanted a nice place to stay, near some kind of public transportation. We booked this hotel through our travel agency and we didn't regret it. The hotel is not fancy, but is really good. The room is quite big, great bathroom, TV and heater were working properly. We absolutely LOVED breakfast, lots of good things to eat. We didn't have any problems with the staff, but not staying too much around the hotel. It's near a train station that comes from the airport and the subway station is just a few blocks from there. If you're not totally lazy, you're not going to find it hard to walk to the subway. There's also a bus stop near the hotel, on the main street. And across the street there's a nice restaurant called Pastarito. I think it's a restaurant chain. The food is good and cheap. I would totally recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Alot better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: copleycop
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with my priority club points so only paid £66.00 for 3 nights. At first I thought it looked run down on the web site but it's in-fact was nice & modern. The front desk where nice and greeted us well. We got a room on the 3rd floor with a balcony which was nice, just to get some fresh air and abit of sun after a long day seeing the sights of Rome. We took the regional train to Roma Tuscolana Railway Station from the airport which cost 8 Euros' and took about 20 mins, this station is a 5 min walk from the hotel, but was very busy with locals both ways. Breakfast was amazing lots to choose from both hot & cold. Try this hotel you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in the Suburbs of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Frequentraveller4950
Reviews.Content: This Hotel, like other Holiday Inn Express Hotels in which we’ve stayed, offers good quality accommodation with value for money. The state of the Hotel is immaculate – recent renewed no doubt. The rooms are clean and well appointed, if somewhat basic in their amenities. The staff is helpful, but serious – as in many similar establishments in Rome. The complimentary breakfast is more than adequate – quite good in fact. The only downside to this Hotel is the location. It is a distance from the centre of Rome, but with easy access by metro or bus, and the area, like so many others in suburban Rome, is a tad run down.

Reviews.Title: “Really clean fresh rooms, amazing power shower! excellent value!! Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: RazeLon82
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a weekend stay at this hotel with my best friend (2 females, 26-28 years old) and I feel compelled to tell fellow travellers the truth about this hotel..... After reading the reviews on here... I began to looking for other hotels to stay at! I was expecting mildew, bed bugs and unfriendly staff... but we had already pre-paid so decided to just endure what ever was in store for us... I cannot believe how wrong the reviews were! The rooms were spotlessly clean, there was fresh linen, and a very clean bathroom! (including a fantastic power shower!) There was also absolutely no mildew in the bathroom. I slept better than I have done in weeks! It was very hard to get out of bed in the mornings! I also did not hear any trains.... The staff were very helpful. (gave us tips on travel into town, local restaurants, looked after our luggage on last day, and called us a cab to the airport when we missed our last train!) Ok, so they probably weren't the most friendly - but who cares? The location is not in the centre of Rome - but its only a short ride to town on the bus! The neighbourhood is like most surburban European towns and cities - nothing wrong with this at all! Totally safe! If you are from Europe or have travelled through Europe, you won't be fazed by this area. I should add that I am the type of person who will complain about poor cleanliness and hygiene in hotels - so you can take this review as very accurate. Will definitely stay here again if I come back to Rome! You should too.

Reviews.Title: “mildew and an aloof staff”
Reviews.Author: love2travelfromnc
Reviews.Content: the hotel is extremely close to Ponte Lungo metro and Tuscolana rail stations which is nice. The staff is there and do speak enough English but as most Roman employees they don't show any emotion or warmth to guests. The breakfast was incredible and quite surprising. I had no complaints related to noise and the room had wonderful double windows that opened into a courtyard. Compared to most European hotels the room and bathroom were a great size. The only real downer other then the borderline rude staff is the mildew in the shower. It was a ridiculous infestation!!! I can't even imagine someone thinking that was clean. The bedding and room seemed clean but after seeing the mildew it weirded me out. The neighborhood is okay. We went to a cute cafe about a 10 min walk away and the neighborhood seemed exceptionally safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: YSW
Reviews.Content: Went for 3 days with husband and 2 teenage girls. The area around the hotel was a bit run down but didn't cause us any problems when we were there. Room was cramped ( but adequate) because of the sofabed but it was clean, inc the shower room. The heating was on which made it very stuffy so we turned it off and slept with the windows open (in february). You could hear the trains with the windows open but it wasn't loud enough to bother us. The beds were made every day and we had clean towels everyday. The breakfast was plentiful and appeared to be well topped up for the late risers. We used the bus and metro to get to and from the centre of Rome. The No 85 bus was about 3 mins from the hotel and took you past San Giovanni in Laterano to the Colosseum in about 15mins for 1euro. The Metro line A at Ponte Lungo was about 10 mins from the hotel. There is a direct train to Fumiciano (airport) from Tuscolana which is only 5 mins walk from the hotel and costs 8 Euros each way.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: strandman46
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay, the hotel was ok, value for the money, great breakfast, nice rooms, although I have some remarks: the reception did not value my platinum status of Priorityclub. Some programmes of our television did not work. The ice machine was out of order and the personal at the reception were not that friendly and helpfull like we are used to in other countries. They charge € 11 for 24 hours internet, which is quite expensive. Yet we had a pleasant stay, it's easy to go to the old citycentre by bus 85 which stops round the corner. We found a delicious restaurant nearby, about 400 mtrs walking at the Via d'Assisi: l' Isola, Via Assisi 144 : great food, genuine Sardinian food, specialized in fresh fish. Nice people, pleasent way of service, several extra's which were not charged. We felt at home. Don't let the reception send you to an other restaurant nearby, for here you will find value for the money and excellent food!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment: moldy ceiling, dirty rooms, terrible coffee....”
Reviews.Author: ElisaBG
Reviews.Content: We had just arrived at the Holiday Inn Express Rome San Giovanni after spending two nights at a Holiday Inn in San Lazzaro (outside of Bologna) and what a stark difference the two hotels were, for a very similar price (both were under EUR 100 per night). While we were pleasantly surprised with San Lazzaro, we were equally disappointed with this hotel. The walls were dirty and scuffed, the ceiling in the bathroom was literally black with mold and mildew growth, there was no fridge in the room so we had to put our food outside on the ledge, the window was downright dangerous (it opened completely and had no barrier, with a 4 storey drop--scary when staying with small children), the bedding was dirty, the beds were uncomfortable, the bathroom was tiny, room amenities consisted of towels and soap and that's it. This place was on par with a youth hostel. Not worth the money. Parking was EUR 12 per night, which is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a Holiday Inn Express?”
Reviews.Author: Holey-soles
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because: 1) the Holiday Inn brand has been reliable indicator of reasonable-priced, clean and comfortable accomodation and, 2) the hotel was located near both train and metro stations to facilitate our travels. We stayed only one night following our arrival in Rome and departed the next morning to catch a train to the Cinque Terre. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Tuscolana train station (TIP: Instead of taking the Leonardo Express from FCO to Termini take the local that stops at all the stations, including Tuscolana. It takes a bit longer but you'll save about 10 euro per person. When going to the hotel, exit the station out the back along the last platform, go down the ramp to Via Tuscolana, then take the first left onto Via Assisi.) The hotel is in an older building backing onto the train tracks so noise can be an issue due to the trains running by and also from people walking on the floating wood flooring in the halls. What were they thinking? PROS: - The front desk staff were helpful and spoke passable English, - The location is handy to the train and metro stations, - The breakfast buffet had a large selection and was tasty. CONS: - Noise is an issue. - The rooms were clean but not overly so. Bedding and towels are sparse. Overall, we don't think this hotel meets the HI standard if you're used to the chain in North America. On this trip we stayed in other hotels, including another in Rome, that surpassed this hotel and offered better value.

Reviews.Title: “Good food, location but dirty walls (molds in ceiling, windows)...”
Reviews.Author: gagnes60
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 9 including a toddler & an adolescent) went there last October. Having stayed at a new Holiday Inn Express in Milan last year, we were hoping to repeat the same 3-star experience. The receptionists were accomodating/business-like. We rented a van & had to pay 12€ parking/night. However, everybody was disappointed with the small room (triple BR), old stained pillows & sheets, cleanliness & service. The only time that we opened our window was on the last day of our stay (it rained) & was shocked to find out that the window sill was full of black molds. My son had his first asthma attack when we went home. I've just read another review from a previous guest abt. 2 months ago stating the same problem with the molds/mildew. Obviously, the hotel didn't do anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “The poorest Holiday Inn ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: JRGreenHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel six weeks before arriving for three nights. As a gold priority club member, I was using my club points for some of the stay. The room rate was expensive for a weekend rate for a city break I thought, considering its location, so useful to use the rewards points to offset the cost. You can probably imagine I frequent a lot of Holiday Inns; this one is by far the most disappointing. The hotel is situated just outside the city, and has easy public transport connections to the city. However, its local location is crap!! The street, its buildings and surrounding areas are scruffy and very dirty, lots of “street art!” if you take my meaning! I was shocked and disappointing for an Express Holiday Inn to be in such a location in a major city. On arrival and having booked two rooms each with a sofa bed via the Club Rewards customer services, and had all the confirmation, we were only offered two standard double rooms. An hour later having been given alternative rooms that were either, occupied or again just doubles but noted cleaned ( we arrived 5pm), we had to except one double and one with a broken sofa bed, but in different parts of the hotel. Although the desk staff looked to be helping, they were indifferent, and certainly were dismissive of a club member staying. So I can only assume none members would be treated even worse. Both rooms were tired, the rooms was surface cleaned, the bathroom was again just surface clean, both had peeling paint, showers that were blocked. Although reported to reception along with the broken sofa bed, nothing was done. The corridors have a wooded floor so very noisy with guest movements through out the night. We also wanted extra blankets; this took a day to sort out for one room, the other room they never turned up. The TV had only CNN in English.big deal! What was good: • Breakfast and those servicing the food & tables congratulation! • They had a wonderful free tourist map • Easy public transport links to the city • Saved a lot of money on a taxi back to the airport booked via reception In summary would I recommend this hotel, No! If you say at Holiday Inns you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good location, in Rome there are much better options”
Reviews.Author: sunshinesmile55
Reviews.Content: I checked in and went to my room, it smelled like cigarettes even though it was a non smoking room. The room looked very low standard and I noticed it was in an older part of the building. I asked the front desk if they could please change my room. The front desk associate gave me such a nasty attitude when i explained to her that the room was very smelly and that i would please like to change rooms. For some reason she didn't want to change my room. I had to do a lot of nagging and trying and finally I got my room changed. The new room was like night and day. It was a great room, better location, and it was in the "new" part of the building. I got very cold at night and there was no heat. I just think there are better options when staying in Rome,and I think its worth it to stay closer to the center, like near the spanish steps area. Even though I got a great deal at this hotel, I wouldn't go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fair”
Reviews.Author: PhillippaF
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean but very small and so are the bathrooms. I would advise that persons travelling from the west pack small face towels as all the towels are the same size. The continental breakfast provides a variety from all food groups and is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Starting to look tired”
Reviews.Author: Richard_BEE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions over the last few years mainly because of its convenient location. However, each time the condition of the hotel and the service offered has deteriorated. The carpet along the corriders is being replaced (slowly) by cheap laminate flooring, which is consderably noisier than carpet. Offerings at Breakfast are increasingly being automated, it is of course common in Italy to find juice and coffee machines at breakfast, but those at this Holiday Inn were constantly broken, with piles of half-full cups and glasses alongside. The ineffectual staff gave the impression of not caring. A lack of Restaurant Manager didn't help. There is also now a machine for dispensing yoghurt, which did, of course, break down whilst we were there. The selection of food at Breakfst time is ok, but the (too) few staff struggle to keep everything topped up, I'll be looking for somewhere else next time I'm Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cost effective stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tauysal
Reviews.Content: This hotel enables a family of four a cost effective stay in Rome which can be expensive. We were upgraded to a larger room which enabled all four of us to stay in one room. We did have to share beds but it was still comfortable. The free breakfast in the mornings was also a great feature. The food was very good, with lots of choices. The hotel is conveniently located near a metro station, only 5 minute walking distance from the hotel. This way, all of the major attractions of Rome are only within a 15 minute metro ride.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay overall; no complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: khadijaox81
Reviews.Content: my husband and myself spend 6 nights at this hotel from late july to early august. each night cost us about £35 for both of us, inclusing breakfast, which we found to be very good value. we had stayed at other holidays inn in different parts of the world before and had always had a pleasant experience, so knew what to expect. We arrived at the hotel at around midnight and were checked in to our room very quickly, the front desk staff explained everything that we needed to know, no fuss. we went straight into our room, in which the a/c worked perfectly, to find it perfectly clean. after reading some of the reviews on this site in which some people complained about the noise in the rooms located near the train station, i emailed the hotel prior to arrival to request a quiet room, and received a very quick, positive response. i would definitely recommend doing the same thing if you want to ensure a quiet stay. on the next morning and for the remainder of our stay, we took advantage of the complimentary breakfast, which i found to be perfectly adequate for the price you pay: scrambled eggs, bacon, cold meats, cheese, breads, several varieties of cakes and danish pastries, yogurts, cereals...... and, best of all: at no extra cost, you can ask the waiting staff to prepare you a fresh coffee in any way you like. we found the staff very professional and accommodating; not particularly smiley or friendly, but then as long as they do the job that they're being paid for correctly, i don't expect them to be friends with me either and do appreciate that they are too busy for that type of things anyway. the location is, like some reviewers said, a bit out of the city centre, but still very accessible using either the tube, 10 mins walk away, or, even better and closer, on via tuscolana, the 85 or 16 bus, which take you to the colosseum in 20 mins. so even though it is not centrally located, it is still close enough to allow you to leave in the morning and come back at some point during the day to rest for a bit before going back out in the evening, which is very convenient in summer as it does get very hot and you'll soon find that you may need to take a second or third shower! you'll also find a good selection of restaurants near the hotels, mostly catering for pizza, pasta and ice cream lovers, but then what would you expect in italy? check out was as efficient as check in, the room was cleaned everyday to a very high standard, so all in all, we were very satisfied with our stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, if you don't mind the AM and PM commutes”
Reviews.Author: edfromvancouver
Reviews.Content: This is your basic Holiday Inn Express , except for a few things, good and bad. Pros: the breakfast buffet was the best of our trip. They really do a top notch job. Be sure to pass up the "American coffee" machine and ask the (sometimes gruff..are they Russian?) helpstaff to make you an Italian cappucino. Cons: Location requires taxis, buses, or metros. The hotel staff recommended the buses but I preferred the metros. If you are sleeping 4 to the room (we had 2 kids), really check out the sofa bed when you arrive to make sure it doesn't have a serious sag. Ours was barely acceptable. And heed the other writer's comments about the train--all I can say is that we had a good room that was quiet, so no complaints there. One last thing: if Rome is your last stop, consider how you will get to the airport. The train station might be the best option. Against my better judgment, I had the desk clerk convince me that a "private car" was the way to go. The price was 50 Euro which is probably not a rip off, but the car was very basic: small and with a broken A/C. Traffic was horrendous, so I think the train (5 mins walk) might have been a better choice. Not sure about that though.

Reviews.Title: “Some good rooms, some not so good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Murrieta1
Reviews.Content: I was puzzled by the mixed reviews for this hotel, but think I now understand it. We stayed here when we flew into Rome and got a room on the street side where the railroad noise is like distant thunder. We stayed here again before flying out and got Room 118, which overlooks the railroad tracks, and the noise was pretty bad. When you first get to your room look out the window: if you see railroad tracks, ask for another room. Overall we found it to be a good basic clean hotel. Nothing fancy, but hotels are expensive in Rome and this one is a good value. We liked the location. It is behind the Tuscolana train station, which is where the noise comes from, but the commuter trains from the airport stop at Tuscolana so you have a straight shot. It is also not far from the Ponte Lungo subway station, and the #16 & #85 buses stop at the corner. It is not in the middle of town, but has good access to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller0969
Reviews.Content: We stay in this hotel for 4 nights, and what an experience! To start with the good things, the rooms were of good size with a balcony and reasonable clean. However, it was very close to the railway and once you opened a window, the train noise was unbearable, therefore, you need to keep the windows closed all the time. The problem is their air conditioning did not function all the time. We were without air conditioning for one whole night, the staff at the reception kept telling us it shall be ready in an hour...and never happened. One of our friends had to change their room 3 times during the night as the hotel staffs kept telling them the air condition was working in the other room.... There were power failures at least twice during our stay, one in the morning which took them half hour to fix, the other power failure happened at night around 9:00pm, and it took them almost 3 hours to fix. We were left sitting in the dark with windows opened hearing the annoying train noises for 3 hours! The drainage in the shower was almost blocked, water was at least 2 inches high covering our feet during shower. I called the reception and they sent a man to look at it, the guy had a quick look at the drainage and said "it's normal"! "Normal"!? - how can it be if water was not draining away!! There were two ice machines on the ground floor and one had a "out of order" sign on it. We tried to use the "good" one and guess what, we only got 3 cubes of ice in 15 minutes! We asked at the bar and requested some ice, the guy at the bar told us "There are no ice in the bar!!" --?? On the morning (around 9:00am) before we checked out, we wished to take a shower, guess what, no hot water! We ask at the reception and the guy told us that he had someone working on it and shall be fixed in an hour....as we expected, never happened, we waited until 11:30am and decided to check out without waiting. The location of the hotel was not good for public transport, a walk to the nearest subway station took us a good 20-25 minutes on uphill, down hill and uneven surface roads. There are no chance of getting back to the hotel for a rest after lunch before going out again. It ended up that we walked to the station in the morning and took a taxi back to the hotel at evenings as we were too tired to walk after a long day shopping and/or sightseeing. The in-room internet connection had reasonable speed, but at 7 EUR per hour, I think it was overcharged. The staffs at the reception was not helpful, seemed to me that whatever question you asked them they did not want to answer, and most of the time, they just didn't answer and gave us an annoying face as thought we were trouble makers! My advice is to stay away from this hotel, we did not expect much from this hotel as this is a 3 star hotel, after the stay, I would guess this is worse than a 1 star!! We stay in Crown Plaza, Holiday Inn and Holiday Inn Express before and found it value for money. This Hotel really make us think twice if we wish to stay in another Holiday Inn Express again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic average hotel, a bit of distance from town”
Reviews.Author: BlueLagoon99
Reviews.Content: Duration: 4 nights stay. If location to town wasn't an issue and if we were only looking at what you get for the room (ours was good sized) and the price, I think this place is value for money. Only thing was while we knew it was a bit of distance to town by metro, we hadnt realised its quite a hike to the metro station from the hotel, about a good 10 minutes casual walk and uphill to the metro, you would also have to cross a main road to get to either of the 2 metros since it is sort of in between them. All in all, if you included walking to the metro and the distance into town, it takes a good 40-45 minutes depending where you get off. So for us, coming back to the hotel for a freshen up in late afternoon before venturing out in the evening which we would normally like to do was out of the question. Neighbourhood was a bit drabby and depressing but we felt safe enough. Our room was of good size and the bathroom facility was basic. Breakfast was good, really cannot complain for this level of hotel. Reception service was moderate.

Reviews.Title: “My clients in my small town jail have better rooms & service,”
Reviews.Author: MRPritc
Reviews.Content: In the U.S., I'd had great service & value from the Holiday Express Inns. So much so, that in my first trip overseas in 2009, we booked a room at the Holiday Express Inn in London at the Royal Park. Their facility, staff, service & location was outstanding. May of 2010, my folks turned 75. For their birthdays we booked a trip to London, followed by a trip to Rome. We stayed at the same Holiday Inn Express in London and were treated like old friends and VIPs. My folks were thrilled. The Rome facility was an evil mirror image of any other Holiday Inn Express. First, there was graffiti all over the exterior of the hotel, the front desk staff made it appear our checking in was an inconvenience. The rooms we were brought to had to be the worse rooms I'd ever been in, and as a criminal defense investigator, I've visited a lot of seamy, seedy, rat & bug infested rooms. In addition, many of the interviews I conduct are at our local outdated, over booked, under staffed & under budgeted jail. So it takes a lot to shock me. I was shocked, dismayed, sickened, and embarrassed to have booked my folks into this stinking sewer. The rooms were not only unclean, they had mold growing in them, the carpets ragged, worn, old, unclean, with burns. The walls were cracked, poorly plastered over, the vents uneven and full of mold, dust and dirt. You have to pay per hour to watch the 13 inch TV. Internet is overpriced and spotty. The rooms were hot. Adjusting the thermostat did nothing, so I went to the front desk to ask them to move me to a room with air. I was informed that it was "out" but "maybe it will be working tomorrow". I asked "maybe, what that does that mean?" The desk clerk shrugged and said I mean it will be working tomorrow, I have a man working on it now." I asked him to direct me to this man, and was informed he wasn't working on it now. I went to the ice machines. One didn't work at all, the other spit out an ice cube every 45 seconds at best. After 5 minutes, I had 6 cubes, and the machine ceased producing. The desk manager's response was maybe tomorrow. I went back to our room, my other half informed me my folks had been able to get their window open. We couldn't. I went back to the desk, on my way down, I noticed doors were being propped open with chairs & shoes. I asked the desk manager if they had any fans. He shrugged his shoulders & mumbled something I later learned was an unkind reference to my mother. I ran into a another family and they'd been stuck there for a few days. They said the air hadn't worked the entire time they'd been there. The manager mostly hid out, and the one staffer who was available was apologetic for the condition of the place but couldn't do anything about it. I called hotel.com who'd booked the rooms for us. We were able to find another hotel (it was Memorial Day Weekend) but it cost us $265 per room to get a refund. Another $800 dollars per room for the rest of our stay which was at a nice Best Western. I can't say enough bad things about this place. How Holiday Inn could allow their name to be on this rat hole is beyond me, and something I plan to find out. I don't know if you can trust the positive reviews about this place. I only wish I'd read reviews about this location ahead of time. Please, I implore you, there is no redeeming value to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JosephKnight
Reviews.Content: Having read the latest review for this hotel, I felt compelled to write a review of this perfectly adequate hotel that myself and my girlfrind spent 3 nights in during May. The first thing to say is that this is a Holiday Inn Express - not a Holiday Inn, therefore it is not going to be a 4 star offering, so do not go expecting it to be so, this means there is not likely to be draws etc but a basic open wardrobe with hangers and a shelf which is perfectly adaquate. We found the room size to be large and although our "double" bed was 2 single beds pushed together, it was comfortable enough and the double glazing meant that whilst the train noises were heard they certainly were not troublesome in the night, and my girlfried is a rubbish sleeper and slept through them!
