The bathroom was clean and the shower weas very good with excellent water pressure and a lovely temperature. Breakfast was great, plenty of pastrys, cereal yoghurt etc and lovely fresh coffee from the proper coffee machine. We did not experience any ants or anything of the sort and always left breakfast stuffed! Although the breakfast times were busy and there was a bit of waiting for things to be replenished tihs was not a problem and indeed when a buffet offering is on the table its not really unacceptable when the restaurant is busy to have a little wait every now and again. Having been stuffed at the free breakfast we did not mind the walk to the underground, it is a good 10-15 minute stroll away and contrary to some reports, the area is really not as rough or bad as some have made out, we felt perfectly safe walking at all hours so this was not a problem, although my feet were sore at the end of the holiday from all the walking what with the sight seeing etc. Check in and out of the hotel went smoothly enough and found the staff to be friendly enough. One thing I would improve would be the TV offering - only one English speaking channel was CNN and it was on a loop, bit dull, but then again i wasn't in Rome to sit and watch TV! I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit Rome on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away at all cost”
Reviews.Author: RBandNB
Reviews.Content: First of all, coming to this area from the Rome Airport via train, then walking the streets to this neighborhood, it was not representative of the website point of view. The neighborhood is seedy and scary for the timid, which I am not. Once you get to the Holiday Inn Express, your thoughts are of an American Hotel chain that is consistently clean & modern. The website shows a beauty. Nothing close to it. They completely mis-represented this dive. This was the exact opposite. It was smelly, filty with excessive amounts of mold around the windows and in the shower / bathroom. The manager still charged us when we requested another hotel in the chain (hoping for a nicer, cleaner area). She was absolutely no help with a rude attitude of "I-frankly-don't-care". It could have ruined our trip if not for another couple checking out after a 1 night stay (they booked 3 nights). We followed their lead to the Hotel Modigliani in Central Rome (near the Dolce Vita) which was a gem and not too much more money.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: wlm7594
Reviews.Content: Would recommend if your needs are basic. My son and I stayed there and found the hotel to be very efficent and accomodating to our needs. The staff was as friendly as they had to be. Which was ok,we did not go to Rome to see them. Continental breakfast was good. Staying at this hotel requires extra travel time and a lot of walking. The hotel is located about 6 blocks from Metro A stop Ponte Lungo, which is about 11 stops from the Vatican. Hotel was very clean. Rooms are small, but comfortable. A double room consists of 2 twin beds pushed together. It more than served our purpose but if I was traveling with more than 2 people I would get 2 rooms

Reviews.Title: “Train Spotting”
Reviews.Author: Flak88London
Reviews.Content: I made the bid mistake of staying at the Express Holiday Inn Rome. Had I realised that the hotel in right next to the main train line into Rome termini station I wouldn't have gone near it. (not enough research. My room was on the groung floor at the rear of the hotel which is 75m from the main train line....the trains run all night and being italian sound their horns as they pass (perhapd to wake all the gurests? The room was clean aprt from the foor prints on the walls the bathroom Ok apret from the mould in the shower. definetly not worth the 140€ I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and in a quiet safe area”
Reviews.Author: Duffnutt09
Reviews.Content: In a quiet residential area easily accessable from the metro. Area is a little shabby but quite safe. Took me 45 minutes to the vatican via the metro access to all of the city is really easy. the 7 day tourist tickets for the tube and buses is good value. Room was clean spacious and just what you would expect from an express, staff very helpful. Breakfast is good but can get a little crowded so I chose to go down early. Some places to eat nearby but you are only 15 minutes from central area so eating not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, location is not so great.”
Reviews.Author: AADG
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, good service and great rooms, even a continental breakfast included. Location was not so great for us, the distance to the center of Rome could take us like 45 minute by bus. And the surroundings are not so nice to see either. Our last night we returned to the hotel and tried to find a nice restaurant or a nice place to have dinner, but we couldnt find any. We ended eating some pizza that didnt seem italian at all. The surroundings of the hotel were really not nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you needed with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: texstar20
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel. The staff was extra friendly with all of our needs. Breakfast was great and the location was perfect. It's nice to be out of the city in the heart of San Giovanni. We found excellent restaurants and markets right by the hotel. Everything was within walking distance. The rooms were very clean and had everything you needed. Simple European room, which I loved. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great value and real Rome experience.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: rlhvet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn San Giovanni for three nights. We were a little unhappy to start with cause it wasn't in the nicest neighborhood. We planned our excursions so that we be off the underground and through the couple of blocks to the hotel before dark. No complaints about the price or the ammenities though. We had a couple of bug bites there looking back but didn't make the connection. NOW, only 10 days later, we are getting eaten up by bed bugs. UGH! I called the exterminator and have ordered a replacement mattress. This trip is going to cost us ALOT more than we planned.

Reviews.Title: “Roma is a Top city to be on New Year 2010 (From Atlanta, Ga)”
Reviews.Author: Traveler-Family-4
Reviews.Content: We went and spent 10 perfect days at Rome, my hisband and 2 kids. This is the most beautiful city i ever seen. Hotel is clean, quiet and great breakfast. We will looking to go soon again.... Rome is the City!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: colusa1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. Upon first sight, seemed like a bad area but was actually a great, centrally located hotel. We walked all over and felt safe. The rooms were clean and they served a fantastic breakfast. But if you are reading the amenities for this hotel, beware, they are incorrect. There is no coffee maker in the room. No safe, and no currency exchange on premise. They wouldn't even cash a euro travelers check unless it was to pay my bill. Could have been a bit friendlier, but then they could have been having a bad day. Over all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, well-managed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sinoitalian
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much. It was a great value for what we paid, which was around $140 per night. Hotel is reasonably new, our bed was very large, everything was clean, breakfast buffett was very good. It is not really close to downtown but, not matter where you stay in Rome, you will be some distance away from at least some of the main attractions. The subway and buses were convenient, so we did not feel that the distance was an issue. The staff is efficient, if not overly friendly. One of the people at the desk helped us solve a problem with our camera. We will definitely stay here again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple”
Reviews.Author: jaywalker2309
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the HI express in San Giovanni, altho thats pushing it to say its there. Its really by Porte Lungo.. Still possible to walk to the vatican if u have good shoes on ;) Hotel was very simple but clean and very cheap for where it was. Would stay again when go back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: catbuddah
Reviews.Content: Safe clean hotel with decent breakfast buffet and close to transportation. Not a touristy neighborhood, which we preferred. Close enough to ancient Rome that my husband jogged daily on the old tracks of the Circus Maximus. A short bus or subway ride to spanish steps, for example. Decent restaurants in the area, great sandwich shop at bottom of hill, end of street. Nearby supermarkets were a godsend. We didn't have any issue or even notice any train noise, but we live in Manhattan so maybe we're just used to noise. What you'd expect from a large chain hotel, rather generic, but not bad. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical hotel not close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: Now4voyage
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were only passing through Rome, and stayed one night at this hotel. It was a typical hotel-nothing wrong with it, but nothing special either. If you are wanting to see the sights of Rome I would not advise staying here. It is not close to any of the big attractions and it is not very close to a metro station. We did not go out after dark, so I cannot advise about the safety of the neighborhood. It did not look to be in the best area, but then again, I did not feel threatened. There are very few cafes and shops on the street so you must walk several blocks to find food and entertainment. I will say that we did not have a problem (like we did with another hotel in Rome) with traffic noises keeping us up at night. The free breakfast was quite good. There is a wide variety of things to choose from. If you want to use Wi-fi, you must pay for it. Overall, I was not really impressed with the hotel, but then again I don't have any complaints about it either. If you are vacationing in Rome, I would not recommend this hotel, but if you are just passing through like I was, it will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn express, a bit out of the way,”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: As an establishment, this is what you might expect in a Holiday Inn Express in Europe, except for the neighborhood. The building is very utilitarian, clean and compact, and would fit business travelers quite well, except that it really is a bit out of the way as I see it. It is near a train station, which comes in handy when you are leaving for the airport. The subway station is a bit of a walk. The neighborhood is what I imagine most middle class Rome neighborhoods might be, except that it really seems to be dead at night. I was hoping for a bit more activity when we came back to the hotel at 22:00. Instead, the area was rather quiet and dark. The room we had for three was quite adequate and comfortable (though smallish). No complaints there. The breakfast was good and had variety. The staff were helpful. I have one rather major complaint, and that is internet access. First, you had to pay, and that was just to get access down in the lobby. To get this, you have to give the folks quite a bit of information. Then, when you got it, it was a bit slow. I probably would give the establishment a four rating if not for this issue. Thus, in my recommendation, below, I would recommend this place if they take care of this issue, but otherwise I think this is a showstopper for business travelers in that a place like this shoudl provide access, and if not, getting access should not be so onerous.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem not far from the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: OZMARKY
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I found this little gem of a place only stations away from the main hub of Rome. As with most of our accommodation bookings these days, we purchased the Holiday Inn Express online. We found this place to be quite adequate. It was clean, neat, the staff were fairly helpful (except the included buffet Continental breakfast should´ve been advised to us at check-in), and the hotel was not so far out of town that we felt it was a major problem (500 metre walk to the "Pontelungo" underground railway station). The only real negatives were minor. The hotel was not in the nicest looking of neighbourhoods. But many parts of Rome are not as inspiring as I had intimated. We never really felt threatened. And there were no strange people loitering about the streets outside. The room we had didn´t have a great view of anything in particular. Our curtain opened out to a view of the dull car park next door. But we were not planning on spending all day in our room. Rome is for the viewing. Too much to see and do to be staying in one´s room. We understand that when you book cheaper rate accommodation on any `last minute´websites, you stand the risk of not always getting 5 star accommodation. Reality is you get for what you pay for. If we had the funds we would certainly not be booking in this manner. The key is to never have expactations set too high. With that in mind we were happy with what we were given.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: PondCrosser82
Reviews.Content: Location was ok. Short walk to train into city, but for the price we couldn't beat it! Very clean and modern. The staff was wonderful!!! Although my trip was years ago, Daniel and Simone will always be remembered for their helpfulness and insight!

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: Breville
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a reasonable location if you don't mind catching public transport (6 stops on the metro to Trevvi Fountain). Public transport is cheap and frequent so the location proved to be fine. The service however left a lot to be desired. Many of the staff were blunt bordering on rude. Compared to other Holiday Inn Express I have stayed at previously the staff here were well below par. Breakfast buffet was pretty standard although there was very limited seating which resulted in many people milling about for 5-10 minutes until a table became free. Rooms are quite large and the bed was very comfy which was nice. The hotel is in a residential neighbourhood so there is not very much within walking distance to the hotel. There is however a very nice Pizza / Pasta restaurant just down the road which serves delicious food which is very reasonably priced. If I return to Rome again I would probably find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recomended”
Reviews.Author: MercurySandton
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights and found the rooms smallish but comfortable and clean. The night manager was very heplfull with his broken English and was always willing to assist. As far as convenience goes it is well situated although a little out of Rome itself, very close to buses trains and the underground. The area is probably not the most delectable but had no issues and we came home late at night. Would I go back...most definitely and oh yes an excellent morning breakfast included

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again if I was paid to do so!”
Reviews.Author: BigMonya
Reviews.Content: I don't normaly write reviews about hotels and it has been more than 6 month since my stay at this one, but the service was so bad so it kind of stayed in my mind and I felt that I really should share this with people. The rooms were unclean. The shower was discustting (I've attached the picture of the shower because I could believe that it's possible to sell hotel rooms witht this shower heads), when you talk to the hotel stuff they smile and say "yes" but totaly ignore you. Basicaly avoid this hotel if possible. I should say that I work for Intercontinental Hotels Group (owner of this hotel chain) and I've stayed in a lot of different Holiday Inns around the world, but this one really stuck in my memory.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - bad location!”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaFairchild
Reviews.Content: - The staff were great but didn't speak very much English. - The location was out of the way but only a 10 minute walk from the metro station. - Surrounding neighborhood was univiting and somewhat intimidating during late hours of the evening. - Breakfast service was delicious! - Cleanliness was impeccable so it makes up for the hotel's poor location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location. Good stay.”
Reviews.Author: kaywai
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Rome Fiumicino Airport and took a direct train on FR1 to Stazione Tuscolana in about 30 minutes. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the train station so it was very convenient. This hotel maintains good standards of a Holiday Inn Express. Rooms are small but you won't be spending much time in the hotel given the wonderful sights in Rome. Ten minutes walk to the subway station Ponte Lungo will take you to Historic Rome. If you can afford it, choose a hotel downtown. Otherwise, this is a cheaper and very reasonable alternative. I have no complaints and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Functional accommodation, convenient and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: WWW's
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Roma San Giovanni for 3 nights at the end of October as it was an economical base with family rooms for visiting Rome. The hotel is modern and the rooms functional rather than luxurious. For 2 adults and 2 children we had a double bed and a double sofa bed, there was a reasonable sized bathroom with a shower, but storage space was limited with just a rail with 6 coat hangers and some shelf space. As we were only there for the weekend this was not a problem. The only down side was there was no safety deposit box in the room. As this is a Holiday Inn Express, there is limited service but there is a breakfast room. Breakfast was OK, nothing special but even though it was busy, staff kept the buffet replenished and made fresh cappuccino as you waited. Although out of the city centre, the hotel is well positioned, with the 85 bus into the city centre (for the Coliseum and Piazza San Silvestro) at the end of the road, it’s a short walk to the Ponte Lungo metro station (Line A, for places further afield like the Spanish Steps and the Vatican) and close to Roma Tuscolana railway station with the direct train to Fiumicino Airport. The train from/to Fiumicino airport is frequent (even on Sundays) and only EUR5,50 one way. If arriving from the airport by train, at Tuscolana station take the stairs down from the platform, follow the signs for the Via Tuscolana exit and this brings you up on platform 8 (?) then there is a ramp down to Via Tuscolana. At the main road, turn left, then left at the traffic lights into Via Assisi and the hotel is on the left hand side.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Goitaly08
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. We had problems after problems and the staff were not very helpful! 1. There are no safes in the rooms so get ready to carry all your valubles with you everywhere 2. Bathrooms had lots of mildew in the showers and it floods! We asked them to fix this the first day we got there but no response and we stayed there for 5 days!! 3. Breakfast food was okay, but very chaotic in the breakfast room. Juice machine was always broken. 4. We had asked the staff to call for a private driver to take us to the airport and they forgot! 5. Location is okay but not close to much I can't compare this hotel to the others in Rome b/c it was my first time there, but compared to the hotels we stayed at in Florence, Venice and Milan, this was the worse!

Reviews.Title: “Great. Great Great!”
Reviews.Author: PettigiuseDavid
Reviews.Content: The location is in a quiet neighborhood, close to the train station and the subway. The breakfast was excellent, better than expected, and the staff friendly and attentive. I would definitely stay there again. We loved the place, the room was nice, quiet, and well appointed. The perfect place to be sightseeing during the day and come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for travel to airport”
Reviews.Author: SilvAndNick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our last 2 nights in Rome, after travelling in Italy. The hotel itself is quite good, quite new, with large rooms and a good breakfast, quite good value for the price you are paying. The location however is not very good. It's about a 10 minute walk from the nearest metro station. The neighbourhood is not particularly nice. I wouldn't say it's unsafe, but it is dirty and not very appealing. We didn't see any nice restaurants in the area. The convenient thing about the hotel is its close proximity to Tuscalona train station which has a train to the airport every half hour. So for our purposes of having one last day in Rome and then travelling back to Australia it was just right. If you are looking for a good, comfortable hotel at a reasonable price in Rome and are not too fussed where you are staying, this is the right hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for its location”
Reviews.Author: kaywhy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located conveniently from the train station, Stazione Tuscolana. From Fiumicino Airport, you can take a direct train on FR1 to this station in about 30 minutes. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the station. This hotel maintains good standards of a Holiday Inn Express. Don't expect luxury. Rooms are small but ok. Standing shower, no bathtub. A good and free breakfast spread in the morning. To take a train to Historic Rome and the other sites in Rome, you can walk about 10 minutes to the nearest subway station at Ponte Lungo. Very convenient too. I would stay here again for its reasonable price and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: isabou24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Express in early june for 4 nights. Staff : Very helpful, very nice. They let me make a long distance call for free because my long distance card was not working. Also, they had a room ready for us when we arrived even though it was like 6am. Breakfast : Amazing. Lots of choice. Pastries, Cakes, Croissants, cereals, fruits etc etc. Rooms : Very large compare to other hotels in italy. Very clean. Pretty similar to north american rooms. Location : The hotel is not downtown, there is a bus 2 mins away you can take that takes you downtown in like 10 min. It stops near every major areas and passes regularly. There is also a bus to take you to the train station in 10min. One downside about the location is that it is beside a train track which can be noisy all night if your room is in the back.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: BasqueChica
Reviews.Content: This place is terrible. It is dirty and in a horrible location. Don't go here. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: coo321
Reviews.Content: We Were only in rome for 2 days and 2 nights and found Express a good place for a short stay. At first we thought the area looked a bit Dodgey But compared to Rome centre it is not too bad. There is a nice Restaurant (Sacco) just around the corner which, although a little pricey, is very pleasant. It is very close to the Station, Just a 10 minute walk and another 10 to Termini Station. Also There is free parking just outside reception

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised. Good location and great value.”
Reviews.Author: adrianhobson
Reviews.Content: This is a value for money hotel that's well located for a short trip to Rome and offers a decent free breakfast. It was easy to get to & from Fiumicino Airport on the ordinary train (not Leornardo Express). Euro 5.5 gets you to Roma Tuscolana station in less than 30 mins. The train may get crowded so sit near the doors and try to get a rail map so you know the order of the stops. The hotel is in the next street to the station (walk onto Tuscolana and turn left at Via Assissi. Hotel is about 200m - an easy walk even with luggage. We had a good sized room for 3 facing the street. Aircon doesn't appear to operate in April (excellent for the environment - perhaps the UK should adopt the same rules) so the rooms can get hot. Its a good idea to manage the temperature by drawing blinds to keep out day-time sun and open the window to cool the room, shutting it before you go to sleep to cut out any street noise (of which there is some but not enough to call a problem). Rooms around the courtyard may be better in this respect. Breakfast was good - typical HIX but made better by attentive staff who made "real" coffee to order. Breakfast ran to 10:30 so you didn't have to be up too early. A short, 10 min walk takes you to Ponte Lungo metro station from where you can get anywhere in the city for Euro 1. Great value. Metro visually grottier than London or Paris and trains plastered in graffitti. But they run every three minutes. Its a good service. The city is compact so you can see all the main sights in a day assuming you don't want to go inside the Colloseum, Forum or Vatican etc. There was a limited choice of restaurants in the area of the hotel so a better bet is to find somewhere near a metro station, and eat there before returning to the hotel. Our favourite was Ristorante Al Viminale on Piazza del Viminale. It was the kind of restaurant that couldn’t exist in Britain. An unassuming single table in a side street, a long corridor leading to a back room that probably hasn’t changed in 30 years. The tourist menu was excellent value with bread a starter, pasta, anti pasta and modest dessert for about 12 Euros. The clientele were a mixture of old friends and a big group. Great atmosphere. Walk from Barberini along Via Delle 4 Fontane towards Via Cavour/Termini and it’ll be on your right hand side off the Piazza. Getting back to the hotel was equally simple. the surrounding area is a bit scruffy and very graffitti infested and can look a bit intimidating but we never felt it was a problem. On Tuscolana there are local pizzarias and a nearby chain restaurant Pastarito/Pizzarito and a little supermarket. Limited choice of TV at hotel - only BBC World in English. Theres pay access to the Internet in lobby but we couldn't connect to the payment site so failed to access online check-in for return flights despite the helpful offers of staff to help with the printing. Ultimately it wasn't a problem. BA has self check-in kiosks at the airport which were quick and easy to use. Rome is a beautiful city but we also took the time to visit Ostia Antica - South of the city. 2 metros and a train cost Euro 1! Ostia is a well preserved Roman town and, for history buffs, is mindblowing. Limited interpretation on site (English translations) so if you plan to go, do some internet research - you can print off an English guide to the town which gives more info than the site's information boards . We also went to the beach a few stops further down the line which was interesting but deserted. Romans think April is mid-Winter. I suspect it would have been better to get off in the town of Ostia and walk further to the beach - at least there may have been other things to see. On the return to the airport we went to Termini and, just to be posh, caught the Leornardo Express. Its not worth the extra over the ordinary train ride (which doesn't go from Termini). It cost double (Euro 11) and was only marginally more comfortable and a bit quicker. However, if you're catching teh train at the end of your last day as we were it still makes sense because Termini is so convenient. Rome is a great place for a short break. If you're on a budget the Holiday Inn Express San Giovanni is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't sure at first, but great stay”
Reviews.Author: pchristi
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel easy enough, at first the location seemed a bit, shall we say, rough. The hotel itself was well presented, excellent reception and receptionists very well informed. With a bit of exploration we found the location in fact to be excellent for our needs which were on main travel routes but abit quieter at night. The hotel was on the main line direct from the airport direct, metro lines and main bus routes. There didn't seem anywhere that we couldn't get to easily. Breakfast was a veritable feast, and it could be taken al fresco. The family room was more than an adequate size. Two adults and two children with no cramping. Fantastic hotel considering it was only an Express, well positioned for transport, excellent and helpful staff. Yes I'd go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews -- you can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: phalvorson
Reviews.Content: Background: My wife & I visited Rome in Oct 2007. We wanted to find reasonably priced lodging that was conveniently located to the various sites and places that we would want to visit during our 9-day stay. We chose the San Giovanni Holiday Inn Express, and I have to say that we made an excellent choice. Review: First of all, it's a Holiday Inn Express. This means, of course, that it's pretty much no frills -- functional, but lacking in the architectural beauty (inside or out) of a more quaint local inn. You'll get a clean room that's just big enough to unpack a few things but not overly spacious or extravagant. (Side note: Our room had perfectly functioning A/C, and it was in the mid-80's outside when we visited Rome.) With that said, let me take a moment to extol the virtues of this underrated establishment: 1. Breakfast: As stated in other reviews, you get a full spectrum of breakfast foods -- both hot and cold -- and also beverages from which to choose. I hope they don't change this offering, because it really got us going each morning and was already included in our room rate. 2. Proximity to transportaton: The subway, train station, & bus stops were all within walking distance -- and we used all three to dart around the area. The hotel itself is in the southeastern part of the city and not near any specific monuments or locations you would want to visit. But within 20-30 minutes, we could be anywhere we wanted to be within the great metropolis. Head down from the hotel, across the main street, and slightly uphill for another four blocks and you're at a subway/metro stop. Head down from the hotel, turn right at the main street, and walk under the overpass and then you're right at the entrance to the train station. Head down from the hotel and there on the main street are two bus stops with multiple routes to pick from. Each bus stop sign has all of its various stops listed in big print, so you can pretty easily tell which direction it's heading and where it will take you. Note: Public transportation was so accessible and easy to use that we did not need to take any taxis. 3. Proximity to food: Go slightly up past the hotel and there is a large grocery store on the left. Both up past the hotel (about 3-4 blocks) and down by the main street there are many local (and one chain) restaurants to choose from in various price ranges. There is also a gelatto shop down on the main street. We had no problems finding someplace different each night where we could enjoy a meal after a long day of sightseeing. 4. Helpfulness of staff: We asked a lot of questions of the folks at the front desk, and they were always helpful. As stated in another review, someone on duty always spoke English. They know the best way to get there and will tell you which stop to get off at. They also took and returned my wife's insulin (she's diabetic) each night from their bar fridge when we needed it --without complaint. Final note: The Neighborhood I feel the need to make a comment (or two) about the local neighborhood, since several people on this site have offered their negative opinions. First of all, this hotel is -- as you may have determined by now by my previous comments -- not on the main street. It is slightly uphill from the main drag, about 2-3 blocks. This essentially puts it in a neighborhood where the Italian people live and work. There is a car repair shop within 20 yards. There are apartment buildings all around the hotel. There is the local grocery store about 2 blocks up. There is dog poop all over the sidewalk (Italians living in the apartments take their dogs out and don't clean up after them; sorry, that's just the way all Italians live, not just those living near this hotel). It gets dark and eerily quiet at night -- the few businesses nearby shut down, and people returning from work go into their apartments. If a dark street with dog poop on it scares you, then this hotel is probably not the one for you. It is *not* in a dangerous or scary neighborhood as some folks have claimed. It is just not on a hustling/bustling main drag with lots of lights and cars zooming by. (Note: Some folks, like my wife & I, actually appreciate these more quiet and secluded surroundings.) So once you adjust your expectations, and you realize that the strange man in dark work clothes walking towards you at night is just a local guy returning to his home, then maybe we as tourists can not worry so much and try to fit in. What's the saying...when in Rome, act like a Roman?

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ramkirhs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in Rome. It is located out of the city centre but is only about a 10 minute walk from a Metro stop which gets you to all the major sights very easily. The area felt fairly safe to walk around during the day, but we tended to take taxis back at night (as we would in most city centres). There isn't much around the hotel itself, its fairly residential, but that wasnt a problem for us as we were just using it to shower and sleep really, we were out sight seeing for the days and nights. Given its residnetial location it meant it was quiet at night. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was average. Overall, a good value hotel to use as a base for exploring the city, and cheaper than an equivilant standard one that you'd find in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: scottishviking
Reviews.Content: Outside temperature 28 degrees inside temperature 35 degrees and NO airconditioning. Had to try to sleep with windows wide open above a railway platform. Air conitioning was switched off as it is not " the season". Ridiculous and unacceptable Location and breakfast are OK if the above problem was fixed

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 Star Hotel I've Experienced In Europe”
Reviews.Author: kevininfla
Reviews.Content: Desk staff was politely efficient. There always seemed to be someone around who spoke enough English to help us. The hotel offers the best buffet breakfast I've ever had in Europe in a 3 star hotel as part of the room rate...take advantage of it since food is expensive in Rome. Room (207) was immaculately clean and neat, cleanest I've ever had in Europe. The view from the room is not scenic at all but I suspect you're there to see Rome so the room view is probably unimportant. The hotel is in a residential area and we felt safe walking at night. Less than 3/4 mile radius gives you numerous restaurants, banks and grocery stores. The 85 bus stop is less than 1/4 mile. The nearest Metro station approximately 2/3 mile, a 12-15 minute stroll, no problem when we were there but I suspect a bit long in the heat of summer. The hotel is several miles from the central district but public transportation gets you there in approx. 1/2 hour. Be advised: the a/c was turned off at the hotel when we were there in early May. It was cool enough that this wasn't a problem. But I'd ask if the a/c is on before booking a room in summer. I do not know what the temperature need to be before they turn it on. Also note: the hotel backs up to the Tuscolana Train Station. Insulated glass windows block most of the sound but you still hear the muffled sounds of trains when they pass by. They did NOT affect sleep at all. In fact, I wish I knew about the station before arrival. Instead of taking the express train from Fumincino Airport to Termini Station, and then the Metro, and then lugging our bags 2/3 of a mile I would have taken the local train (makes several stops) and gotten off at Tuscolana. Then a short 1/4 mile walk to the hotel. Just note that the local train leaves Fumincino from another part of the airport. Ask about it if you want to take the train. Cost is the same but hassle reduced dramatically. We are independent, budget minded travelers, in our mid-50s, who always book our own trips. We always opt for 3 star hotels in Europe (we save enough by not booking 4 star hotels to afford to stay an extra 1 to 3 days) and this one is my favorite so far (and, I admit, the most expensive as the dollar isn't worth much lately). As long as you are capable (and willing) to walk a bit and you don't mind being away from the central district I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: WNZL0037
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in the same version of this hotel in Milan and the service was exceptionally good... but this one in Rome was terrible... we felt unsafe in the area and couldn't go out at night. Let me be very clear about 1 thing... this hotel is NOT near the centre of Rome. You need to walk several blocks including under a very scary rail overpass to the Metro and then go in to Rome. We took a taxi from the train station to the hotel and it cost E50. The streets were full of rubbish and there was a lot of graffiti everywhere outside. The hotel itself is basic, as expected, but clean and comfortable, good shower. The breakfast food was the absolute worst food we ate in the 4 weeks we were in Italy... the worst coffee, worst, cheapest, most horrible inedible bacon, worst eggs, no gluten-free product available, no fresh fruit. The service in the breakfast restaurant was appalling and I would have thought it would NEVER be appropriate for 2 waitresses to continue a shouting argument across the restaurant, trading insults for nearly 20 mins. which made all the guests feel very uncomfortable. We only bothered eating the 'free breakfast' 1 morning of our 4 night stay. The 'room with a view' on the third floor had a view of a concrete roof with pipes running over it. Hotel overall rating is POOR. Do not stay here. I stay in InterContinental Hotels (Holiday Inn, Crowne Plaza & InterContinentals) throughout Australasia and they are always excellent. This was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for families”
Reviews.Content: Excellent family value! We needed a cheapish hotel room for a family of four-very hard in Rome ! Booked this last minute, we were a bit worried about the area but there was no need. This is a briliant value hotel for families. The room was clean and changed daily, air con worked fine. Despite the photos on this site the area was just a typical Roman suburb, totally safe. Trust me, Ive lived in dodgy bits of south london and this was absolutely fine! The photos on the site are a bit unfair and Im going to put some on from the same point that show a better angle! I would say its the same experience as staying at say the Battersea travel lodge- perfectly good for sleeping but you need to be prepared to travel into town, its purely functional with no Italian character. The hotel calls itself "limited service" and thats what it is. But the satff were very helpful, better service than Ive had at much more expensive places in Italy. And it was clean, safe and had a decent breakfast. Also, tons of Italians and business people as well as families, its pretty popular clearly. Happy to go on record as recommending this!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: gooooogirl
Reviews.Content: Little off center of the city, but the Metro is a short walk. Breakfast is popular, it is a good spread, but not replenished. Try the local neighborhood restaurants. They are excellent, but many do not open until late. Front desk is busy, but helpful. GREAT VALUE!

Reviews.Title: “March 2008 in a triple room”
Reviews.Author: London018
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during March 2008 in a triple room booked through lastminute.com. The room was a bit crowded with the three beds and associated luggage. It also backed directly onto the train line however I can't say that we found the noise from the trains to be a problem nor did it wake us during the night. Overall the room was clean and the hotel staff friendly. The hotel did a very good breakfast consisting of cereals, meats, cheeses, yoghurt, coffe, juices and toast which was included in our price. The location of the hotel is outside of main Rome but is accessible through public transport which the hotel staff will provide you with a map for. There is a metro station less than 10 minutes walk away (Ponte Lungo - Line A) and a bus stop less than 5 minutes away. The metro will take you to termini (where you can change onto Line B) and Spagna for the Spanish steps. The bus stops right outside the colosseum. If you are willing to use public transport and are looking for a cheaper standard hotel then this hotel fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: YorkBritGirl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for three nights in May 2007. We booked it as a last minute weekend break. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel. The location was OK from the airport (Ciampino). As it is outside the city walls it is the cheaper of the two flat rate taxi tariffs from the airport - we got a taxi as we arrived late and wanted to get straight to our hotel and, although fairly expensive, you know what you're paying before you get in so we were happy. On returning to the airport we took the Metro to the end of the line (Anagnina) and then took the airport bus which cost 2 euros each. The hotel location was also fine in terms of public transport into Rome: a 5-10min walk from the metro (N.B. the metro closes early - around 8pm when we were there) which is then only a short journey to the main attractions. We picked up a three day travel card from the train station (Roma Tuscolana) near the hotel (for directions, see below) for around 10 euros each. We only used the metro (from Ponte Lungo metro station: for directions, see below), but previous reviewers have noted the close location of a but stop too. We checked in around 11pm and the staff were helpful. We were very pleased with our room - it was a decent size and with a good sized, comfortable bed and a very good, clean, bright bathroom. The shower in particular was very good. We had no problems with noise as some previous reviewers have said, but this may be because our room was situated towards the front of the hotel with the window backing on to the courtyard - away from the railway lines which are very close by. The air conditioning unit worked and wasn't too noisy. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were very friendly. There was lots to choose from and the breakfast area was bright and inviting. Checking out went smoothly. Our flight left Rome some time after our check out time and so we left our luggage in the secure luggage room near the hotel reception, had some more time in Rome, and collected it later. We were very pleased with this hotel and it was reasonably priced. The location was fine for our purposes - a first time excursion to Rome. However, if you want to be near to the centre of Rome then this location might not suit you and next time I think we'd stay more centrally, but this is no reflection on the hotel itself. Travel: To get to the train station (Roma Tuscolana) you turn right out of the hotel, along to the end of the road and turn right, walking under the railway bridge. Bear right at the next junction and the station is a hundred yards or so on the right. N.B. go to the post office type shop on the right of the entrance, not the ticket counter, to get a travel pass. To get to the metro station (Ponte Lungo), bear left rather than right at the junction after the railway bridge, cross the road (you're aiming for the flower stall on the other side) and follow the street (Via Gela) straight up to the end - the entrance to the metro station is clearly marked at the top of the street. N.B. It's all true what they say about traffic in Rome! - you've just got to put your head down and walk if you want to get anywhere. Don't rush as this tends to mean motorists don't slow down. Just walk at a normal pace - they're (the motorists) used to it. But do be particularily mindful of scooters which tend to skirt around the slowing traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast bar!! Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jububbles
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff were really helpfull and knowlegeable about Rome and the area where the hotel is situated. The breakfast is amazing. If you have a continental breakfast anywhere in the world it will be quite simple, but not in Italy! There were different types of homemade cakes, pastries; breads, cheeses, salamis, fruits, yogurts, nutella, jam, etc and there was somewhere there to make you a hot cup of Latte or Capuccino. It was so much food that we didn't have to have lunch sometimes. There is a restaurant near by called Pastarito (??) that is really good and cheap. Pasta dishes were around £5-7, but were huge and very tasty. Holiday Inn Express are normally a quite simple and no-fuss hotels, but great if you are travelling on a budget and looking for a safe and clean hotel to stay. I'll definetly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WillisLondon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel, We thought this hotel was in a good location (just a 10min walk from the Metro st) and only a few quick stops on the Metro to wherever you need to get to. The hotel staff we really helpfull also make sure you get a map of the area at the reception we found this a great help. Although the area look scruffy don't be put off by this most areas within Rome look like this. My b-friend and I found that the fixed cost of 120 euros per night was a real bargin and this price included breakfast which was also pretty good I would definitely recomend this hotel for a cheap weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: OliJ
Reviews.Content: The walk to the metro station takes about 10 minutes. There are a couple decent eateries nearby. Ask the locals. The breakfast was ok. Clenliness was acceptable. There was no AC when we went and keeping the window open made it a bit noisy. If you're looking for luxury this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Out of town price but only a few minutes from the centre”
Reviews.Author: RichardOrmson
Reviews.Content: As noted by earlier reviewers, this hotel is in a residential area outside the city centre. In my view that's no bad thing as long as you can get to and from it easily - in this case you certainly can. To / from the airport you can take the stopping train (half the price of the airport express, and only about 5 minutes longer journey) to Tuscolana station which is literally next to the hotel. If you come out of the Via Tuscolana exit of the station the hotel is just up the first road on the left - about a 3 minute walk. To / from the city centre you need to take either the metro red line or a bus. Several buses stop outside the Tuscolana station (see above) and the metro is about 3 blocks (5-10 mins walk) away - ask for a map at reception. Red line metro takes you to several of the major sights including the Vatican; change to the blue line for the Colosseum The hotel itself is clean, well maintained and has reasonably spacious rooms - and is certainly good value for Rome. Rooms are furnished in the usual Holiday Inn style - which is good quality, but hardly typical Italian. The rooms are arranged in three blocks around a central courtyard. This could be nice for evening drinks in summer, but it was October when I stayed, so the area was very quiet. The buffet breakfast has a very good range, including freshly made coffee in all the italian styles. Bar service is available in the evening, but there is no catering on site aside from breakfast. However there is a good range of restaurants within 5 mins walk on the Via Tuscolana, and as these cater mostly to locals the prices are pretty low by Roman standards. Front desk staff all have good english, as do most of the other staff. Only point to note is that the hotel is next to a station - if you want to sleep with the windows open you may need earplugs. If you can live with aircon and keep the windows shut, the double glazing is very good and you wouldn't really know the trains are there.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jow21
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay in Rome. (Oct 2 ) Holiday Inn Express was the ideal place to stay, it was clean, secure and with very helpful english speaking staff. The area around the hotel is very safe even at night but I must add we were nearly put off by the photos a previous guest had posted on to this site. If you have seen these photo`s don`t be deterred. The location of the hotel is very good for getting to see the sights around Rome. At the bottom of the street in which the hotel is situated , turn right and there is the 85 bus stop, this will get you where you want to go. The metro is also local and the quickest and cheapest way of reaching the Vatican. I would recommend this hotel to other traveller`s. Almost forgot breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, near to public transport”
Reviews.Author: KRR02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is neat and clean but is a bit expensive if not pre-booked at special non-refundable rates available through the hotel website only. Cheapest rates are from the hotel website and not through general hotel booking sites. The complimentary breakfast was quite decent. Hotel staff was quite co-operative and ofcourse english speaking. Television was malfunctioning and hot water supply was irreguar. But the hotel staff took efforts to restore the supply. The hotel is in a predominant residential locality and appeared quite safe even late at night. It is quite close to the bus stop and to the metro. Even from the airport the slow train stops at Roma Tuscolana station (takes about 35 min) which is walking distance from the hotel. Need not take the faster but expensive Leonardo express from the airport. You can save a lot of money on cabs. In Rome, if you get a good hotel within walking distance of any metro station, it should be good enough. Distance from termini station should not be major consideration. It hardly takes any time to reach termini with the metro from anywhere. Overall I recommend this hotel to budget travellors.

Reviews.Title: “Not central, but close enough”
Reviews.Author: kguerra
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn San Giovanni is in a residential neighborhood of Rome. Many reviewers have written how it is not in a pleasant area of Rome, but the neighborhood is just like every other neighborhood in Rome, unless you stay in the central tourist part. The hotel is nothing fancy, but it is clean, the staff is helpful and the breakfast buffett they offer is really quite nice. If you don't mind taking the subways and taxis, this is a good option in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Far out of the main city. In a not-so-nice part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: VisitingItaly
Reviews.Content: First, I'd like to say this hotel is not close to downtown. It's located far away in a not-so-nice neighborhood where there's a lot of graffiti on walls. The Metro is about 6-7 Rome blocks. If one has luggage, it's not practical to drag them to the hotel. Here's what I can share to anyone thinking about booking this hotel: Rooms are ok. Breakfast good but you'll be quizzed every day on your room # by the same service people who do not speak English. I was sadly surprised being that Rome is a major city and the Holiday Inn is an American hotel chain. The worst thing was every evening after touring this wonderful city we found that this hotel disabled the room magnetic-card keys. I discovered this because I stayed here 3 nights and it happened every night. Each night they gave me a different reason but then I witnessed this happening to other tourists there. I figured they do this for security reasons but they don't tell their customers. Every night we arrived at hotel at 20:30 which is not late. I will write Holiday Inn here in America to inform them of the disabling the room keys. This is unacceptable. Another thing, getting directions was difficult because no one speaks English. I recommend, either knowing your way around with good maps or speaking good Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget, but quite far...”
Reviews.Author: MariaZK
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome on my own and booked a single room, which was great. This hotel chain usually gives great quality at low prices and this was no exception. The room was very large and had all the standards. The bathroom was not very large, with a shower, but I wasn't expecting a romantic jacuzzi anyway! Breakfast was included and the buffet was very, very complete, but remember to ask the waiters for your coffee instead of having one from the coffee machine, because this one was disgusting, the other one was much better. The major complaint I had was the distance to the city centre. It is very far. The name San Giovanni comes after San Giovanni in Laterano church, but it's almost 30 minutes walking from there. I knew that and had planed to use the underground, which was usually fine, except for one day when I found it closed because of a public transport strike and I walked for two hours to get to the Vatican!! (I took pics along the way so it wasn't that bad but imagine, it was very sunny and warm). By the way, if you take this hotel, you should know how to get there by underground the first time. From Termini you take line A and get off at Ponte Lungo. But the problem here is that there are several gates to the streets and you can get lost if you don't take the right one, so be careful: In the station, go always left (I think you have to turn left twice after you check out with the ticket) and then, you will find two steps up to the street, one left and one right. There you have to take the right one, marked as VIA GELA. You climb the steps and go straight till you cross the street and turn right (you'll leave a supermarket at your left side and go under a bridge). Go on for about fifty meters after you leave the bridge and you'll find Via Assisi at your left. The hotel is the building you can see with flags at the door. Just go up the street and you're done! I don't recommend this way if you're carrying heavy suitcases but with trolleys it's fine. The area might seem a bit dark and scary but I have to say no one tried anything and I felt perfectly safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthamptonTourist
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by other reviews of this hotel, i found it to be an excellent hotel if travelling on a budget. The hotel was modern, clean and the service was excellent. The hotel is not located centrally but is close to the Metro network with daily unlimited travel only 4 Euros per person. The area the hotel is located in is ok but not exactly upmarket but i felt safe enough day and night with plenty of shops and places to eat out. Overall well worth a stay if travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: GB73
Reviews.Content: The hotel had clean rooms and friendly staff. The hotel arranged for a shuttle to pick us up from the airport for a fee. The breakfast was good. The room was clean. The metro was a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The was a good restaurant less than 2 blocks away. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very poor customer service overall”
Reviews.Author: geekgirl53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 10, 2007 and July 12, 2007. The first visit was very pleasant. We arrived a little early and were given a room right away. I had requested to be away from the tracks based on earlier reviews and was given room 108 facing the courtyard with a small balcony. Floriana checked us in and she was very friendly and very helpful. Nice room, clean but the shower door was off it's track so that caused water to get on the bathroom floor. I couldn't find anything in the room listing how to call the front desk so I mentioned the door when I checked out but they didn't make much of it so it's probably still broken. Overall, the first night was very pleasant. We left for one night to visit another area and returned to check in on July 12. After waiting for one person to check in and a long conversation between a guest and the front desk we were greeted by Nunzia - not friendly or helpful. She bordered on being rude. Maybe she was just having a bad day but maybe not since others seem to find the staff here unfriendly too. I had reserved a double with a sleeper sofa and requested a room away from the tracks and was given a small double room (can't remember the number but it had steps going down to the bed from the door and up to the bathroom) so I went back down and waited for Nunzia to check in someone else then asked if I could have the room I had reserved. She said none were available so I asked for a room without steps because I was afraid I'd trip in the middle of the night if I got up. After at least 10 minutes of talking to her manager (in Italian of course since she seemed to have a lot of difficulty understanding english) she said she had no rooms like I had reserved and she could give us another double room but she wanted me to wait until she checked in the line of people that had accumulated in the lobby and were waiting behind us. I said no, I waited my turn twice previously and I was already there so please finish us before moving on. She didn't like that I guess so she gave us a noisy room that had a lot of water damage on the furniture (maybe a past leak somewhere?) that was so tiny you could barely get around the bed. It was room 114 so be aware if you're assigned this room that you pretty much have to crawl over the bed to get to the side next to the window. Breakfast was the good point for this hotel, good variety, plenty there to eat. It's about a 10 minute walk from the Ponte Lungo metro stop. Via Assisi is not named that until it crosses Via Tuscolana so if you're looking for that street name after leaving the metro stop you won't find it. Walk past the Gymnasium ( on your left as you exit the metro) and turn left at the end of the block and go to the bottom of the hill. Turn right and go under the bridge and the next left (at the light) is Via Assisi. There is a crosswalk at the intersection but watch for scooters - they don't always wait for you to cross if they're turning onto Via Tuscolana.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Col007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as a group of 50 work colleagues in June 07. I initially booked this because of the high cost of staying in the City centre of Rome. I can not comment about how good or bad it is to get from Campino airport as I had organised our own private coach to collect us and take us back. However what I can say is for what you pay at this hotel you can not go wrong. After arriving earlier that the advertised room time of 2pm we all sat in the bar and as rooms became ready we were all given keys-etc. The rooms are typical Holiday Inn Express clean, nicely decorated, nice bathroom, air-con, TV, coffee tea massive king size bed etc etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful and as mentioned in earlier reviews the breakfasts are brilliant, a lot more choice than the UK EHI's. If you can't find anything to eat from the mountains of fresh fruit, cereal, scrambled eggs, bacon, cakes, breads, yorgart fresh milk , orange juice, grapefruit juice, coffee, tea ...need I say any more!! The hotel itself is in a suburban area approx 2 miles from the city centre. Buses as described earlier in the reviews are every few minutes and stop at the bottom of the road (20 mins into the centre but it's well worth using once or twice to see some of the sights you might not otherwise see. Use Bus 85 to get to the centre (turn right out of the hotel to the bottom of the street turn right again and you will see the bus stop in front of you by the newsagents. THIS IS THE BEST WAY TO GO TO THE COLOSSEUM AS THE BUS PASSES RIGHT BY IT AND THE TREVI FOUNTAIN IS VERY NEAR THE TERMINUS. The metro station is a ten minute walk and although other reviews tell you to turn right at the bottom of the road, we found that if you cross straight over at the bottom instead of turning right walk up the road to the top (next main road) cross over this road and then walk right along it this will take you right to the metro steps and there are many shops, stall and markets up there. This area on a night is alight with local pizzeria, restaurants etc, all of which speak very little English which was fantastic as we didn't know any Italian!! (I now reallise how ignorant we are as english to other languages but had some fun having to fend for ourselves) 2 pizzerias you need to know about up here which were fantastic and were all heaving. The first is when you get to the bottom of the road from the hotel, cross over and carry on walking up hill. About half way up on the right hand side tucked in at the end of a Cul-De-sac between the apartments. (I can't remember any of the names you you will find them easy enough, this one has a green light outside across the front of the place with people sat outside also) Also the second one is further up this hill to the second road and instead of turning right to the metro go straight across onto the precinct you can't miss this place on the right there must have been 150 people inside and outside. We had a short wait for this one but it was fantastic to eat with local families and the food was superb. We are already planning a revisit for next year and without doubt if a small amount of walking does not put you off stay at this holiday inn express, save some money and buy yourself something nice instead of wasting it in the centre on a hotel, and as they always say "when in Rome" this is the way to try it!! Don't let the reviews of this being a 1* hotel put you off you won't have time to spend in your room anyway if you want to see everything that Rome has to offer. One further tip, there is a nice courtyard in the centre of the hotel if you can get a room overlooking this it is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: michellealan
Reviews.Content: We have never been to Italy so we were unsure of what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised at cleanliness and convience.I have seen a few reviews with concerns regarding location, we found the location to be perfect. The bus stop is literally around the corner. The bus takes you to all the major sites. The train station is just a few feet past the bus stop and the subway (metro) is only another 5 minutes walk past the train station. The hotel is an urban residential area that is quiet and safe at night. The breakfast buffett puts others to shame. It has a spectacular variety of items that change a little each day. We brought our young kids and teenager as well as our parents. It was perfect for all of us. we were comfortable and centrally located. You could not be closer to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Some minuses”
Reviews.Author: AGTraveller
Reviews.Content: Okay, so we are staying at the hotel right now and wireless access in the room is not free. As has been mentioned, the hotel's room rate is the big plus, and there is public transportation somewhat readily available. But the Metro stop is a good 10 minutes walk that is not exactly pleasant, and during our stay this week (July 2 - July 7) the Metro only runs till 21:00, supposedly due to some construction work. But the hotel staff made no effort to inform the residents of this, even though most of us rely on the Metro to return from the city center, which is at least 20 minutes away. Buses coming back to the hotel from the city center are not frequent. The hotel staff is young, as has been pointed out. And while in the past they may have been helpful (judging from previous reviewers), they are no longer that. They seem busy with something all the time, and rather impatient in answering questions. When we arrived in early afternoon, we were given a room that's not what we requested, and when we complained, we were given a room facing the train tracks. So we had to shuttle among rooms before we get what we needed. Also, the room key machine apparently was not working that afternoon and so we did not get our room keys until later in the day. The breakfast buffet is one of the hotel's best points. The room is modern and clean, but has no closets or shelf space to speak of.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, & very clean hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dm99
Reviews.Content: Accommodation in Rome is very expensive, and while this place wasn't cheap - we paid around 90 Euros a night for a double room - it seemed to be the best we could get in the week after Easter 2007. It is by far the most modern and clean tourist class hotel I have stayed at in Rome. It is located outside the old city walls, so not everywhere is within walking distance. But the subway is about a 7 min walk away, and there is a bus that stops just down the street. The hotel reception staff provide you with a map with the details of the subway, train and bus routes, and it is actually very cheap and easy to get around. The room was great for us. A king size bed, very comfortable, extremely clean. Great bathroom too, with good water pressure and lots of hot water. Our room was located on the street side of the building, overlooking the courtyard, so we didn't notice any noise from the train line (which is on the other side of the building). The buffet breakfast was included, and had quite a good selection of food. I would recommend this hotel to tourists on a budget, who want to stay in clean surrounds rather than a dodgy city hotel or hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: lochgarman
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for three nights upon arriving in Italy, and found the place a good base for rome. the hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from the porto lungo metro station, so you can get about the city quite easily. The hotel was modern and clean inside, and our room was good, with air con and no noise ( we werent near the tracks). Breakfast was pretty average, though that wasnt a big deal for us. We asked about eating nearby, and were recommended by reception to try Sacco, a restaraunt just a few minutes from the hotel. This place was excellent, full of italians which is a good sign, and the food was great. All in all, i'd recommend this hotel without hesitation, due to its good value, cleanliness, and access to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Call your own taxi!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: autumnfairy76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June. The rooms are what is expected by most american travelers from a Holiday Inn, although our second bed was a sofa bed, the walls had water damage from the shower and furniture in the lobby and sofa in the room were grungy. My travel companion complained of the view of a rusty fan and the train tracks, but I was fine with it. I'm not in Rome to look out the hotel window. The air conditioning worked great while we were there and the breakfast was the best I've had in any Italian hotel (and I've stayed in many!) The woman at the desk was extremely helpful with sightseeing and transportation questions. My biggest complaint and warning is this: DO NOT ALLOW THE STAFF TO CALL YOU A TAXI!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We asked for a large taxi to fiumicino airport and were told it would be 75 euro. Although we agreed to this price, we were NOT told that it would not be a true legal taxi, or a limo service. I have good information that it was NOT a limo service. NO legal taxi driver would risk their 100,000euro taxi license by racing at 70 mph, flying through red lights, through the little streets of Rome, with 2 small children in the car, arguing against the requests (in perfect Italian) to slow down, and not have a meter in the van. ALL LEGAL TAXIS HAVE METERS! A male night staff member called this "taxi".

Reviews.Title: “I hated this place”
Reviews.Author: negeo
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? I made reservations well in advance. Judging by the earlier reviews I made a request to be placed away from the noise of the nearby train station. So what happened when we arrived? They did not have the room they promised. Instead I was placed in a room that had a view of the rails. To be honest the noise wasn't that bad when the windows were closed, but it was a mistake nonetheless. After two days of replacing our bed sheets and pillow cases they decided to stop and simply stayed with the used ones. I have never seen this done before in the states. I had to ask them to change the bed sheets after our third night there. Around our 7th night there the air conditioning stopped working. I complained about this but they simply said that it was a city wide problem, something about power conservation or something like that. I couldn't really get a straight answer from them. Anyway we had no air conditioning our last three nights there. We had to have our windows open in the evenings, luckily trains weren't that frequent. The staff was about as unfriendly as you can get. They pretty much gave a poor impression of the Roman people and the whole experience there makes me think twice about visiting Rome again. Finally, I never realized how ghetto-looking Rome was in and around the city. This neighborhood is covered with graffiti. As you make your way from the train station to the hotel you pass by graffiti and dog poop that litters the sidewalks. I guess the locals don't care that much about their neighborhood. Anyway a terrible experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern clean hotel, little far out”
Reviews.Author: kb1977
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star hotel, not 1 star as some other reviewers have stated. We arrived at 12.30pm and asked for a quiet room on a high floor and was given the last room on the top floor which was huge and silent throughout our 5 day stay. We flew into Ciampino airport - caught CONTRAL bus (1 euro + 1 euro for large luggage) which took around 40 minutes to Metro line, then got metro (1 euro) to Pointe Lungo - 15 minutes - easy, quick and cheap. It is not in the best looking area, but we never once felt unsafe whilst walking around. We even walked back to the hotel from Termini on the first night as we weren't savvy with the bus/train situation - this took just over 1 hour. As other reviewers have said the metro is much quicker than the 85 bus, although the trains stop at 9.30pm as works are being carried out (building metro line C so expect this will go on for a while). The 16 and 85 bus run until 12 at night. There is a supermarket called Todis just under the railway bridge which is super cheap - 12 bottles of 0.5 litre water for 1.50 euros!! which is the same price as 1 bottle in central Rome. they also sell huge fans for 12 euros - handy if the air con is off! I was a bit disappointed with breakfast following the rave reviews - it wasn't great - well not if you're british anyway! cold meats/cheeses, pastries, pizza, sandwiches and desserts such as blamange and pineapple upside down pudding! There is cereal and scrambled eggs and european style streaky bacon, but no toast/toast maker. However 'when in Rome'... I was eating puddings for breakfast by day 3! Tried the recommended restaurant Torquiti, it was just ok, no English is spoken but we had a phrasebook so just about managed. Our food wasn't great but we might have just ordered the wrong thing. It was pretty expensive as well - we ate in Ciampo de'Flori cheaper at a traditional little Italian and the food was out of this world! You could find better hotels more central to Rome, but you will pay double so need to sum up whether it's worth the extra money. Rome itself is one of the most fantastic cities in the world, and I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FinNYC
Reviews.Content: If you are a family of four traveling to Rome, good luck trying to find reasonably priced accomodations with decent quality. Well, it is possible. We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express San Giovanni in Rome for 3 nights just before Easter. It is in a mostly residential area on the outskirts of Rome. You have to walk through a slightly run-down street but we did not feel uncomfortable. Getting into the city is easy because the hotel is less than ten minutes walk from two metro stations, or literally around the corner from the train station which connects to the airport and city center. Though close to the train tracks, there were no issues. We got 2 double rooms because the hotel does not have quads, but we still paid less than we would have for a skanky double in the city. The hotel is practically new, and our rooms were very clean with no maintenance issues. They serve a good breakfast with the usual Italian offerings (no fresh cooked to order, lots of pastries). If you ask, they will make a fresh espresso or cappucino, but the brewed cafe Americano is reasonable (European strength, not weak). On the nearby main avenue is a great family restaurant called Pizza Pasta, or Pasta Pizza, or something like that. Really good food, well priced, but the desserts were weak.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: lkl265
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 children) stayed here from 28 May to 1 June 2007 (4 nights). Our room was very close to the railway line (see photo). So after the first night, I asked to be moved to another room. However, I was told that the hotel was full. I asked again on the following day and this time they moved me to a room away from the railway line (still I could hear the trains). The downside was new room was smaller. The front desk staff was not very friendly. On the last day, I asked for a late check out. Without even checking how full the hotel was, I was told I had to vacate the room by 12:00 PM. When I showed them my Priority Club membership card, I was given an extension until 12:45!. In the end, we checked out around 9:00 AM and left the bags in the store room. On the plus side, the free breakfast was great and the location was quite good. Train station was 3-4 minutes walk (exit via platform 8) and the Metro was a 8-9 minute walk. Bus stop was about a 2-3 minute walk. Bus #85 takes you directly to the centre for 1 Euro (we bought a weekly bus/metro ticket for 16 Euros), which takes 30-45 minutes depending on the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “No airconditioning, very loud train noise, very unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LoveEurope399
Reviews.Content: My husband and I originally booked a room for 5 nights beginning April 30th, but due to the heat (hotel refused to turn on a/c), noise from the train coming what seemed like every 15 minutes (loud screeching brakes) and the unhelpful staff we left early. We paid approximately $200 a night for a small room with a double bed. It was hot in Rome at the end of April and the hotel staff advised they could not turn on the a/c due to there being a law in Rome prohibiting air conditioning being used before June 1st (I don't know whether this is true or not, if it is true why is it not stated as such on their website). I asked for a fan, they advised they did not have any. I asked where I could buy a fan, they did not help me at all. Again, due to the heat we had to leave our balcony door open when we were in the room (even at night). This made me feel insecure as our balcony connected with other balconies and anyone could have come in our room during the night. With the door constantly open we had no privacy either. The noise from the train may have been at an acceptable level if we had been able to keep the balcony door closed. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ladyjaneuk
Reviews.Content: Spent an excellent 4 days at this hotel. Staff very friendly and hotel clean. Although out of the city centre a minibus is provided in the mornings and late afternoon/evenings to the nearest tube. This made traveling in and out of the centre easy and you also get to experiene life on public transport. wow!!! so busy at all times but half the fun was getting on and eventually getting off.. great would def reccomend

Reviews.Title: “stolen baggage from the lobby”
Reviews.Author: emelt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Rome - San Giovanni for 3 nights during our 8 day trip in Italy. On our last morning, we were told to leave our baggage at the lobby while breakfast and we did. When we returned, we sadly found out that one of our baggage, the one containing most of our gifts, was missing. Since we wouldn't be able to go back and get new ones, it was really devastating for us. The staff members were not even slighly interested in the situation. We asked for police assistance but they didn't even bother to call; saying the police could do nothing about it. Nobody asked about what happened or anything; as if nothing had happened. The apathy, the staff members showed, made us regretfully think that some of them may have something to do with the robbery.

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning And Train Noise”
Reviews.Author: rackydu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Rome - San Giovanni for two nights, April 28-30, 2007. We booked at this hotel because of the great previous reviews on this web site and a good rate that we got at the Holiday Inn Express web site for a room that was advertized to have INDIVIDUALLY CONTROLLED AIR CONDITIONING. The room was nice, the breakfast was plentiful, but we were sleepless during our stay! The reason for our sleepless state was that Rome was already quite warm at the end of April, our room's air conditioning did not work, and with the windows open, we were awakened by trains passing by since our room backed up to a major rail line. The hotel claimed that they had not yet turned on the air conditioning for the summer season, even though Rome was already quite warm, and they did not offer us a room in a quieter part of the hotel away from the railroad tracks. We would not stay here again because of this unpleasant experience, although it could have been a very nice stay if we had a room with functional air conditioning. The location, while on the outskirts of Rome, provided easy access to the center of Rome via bus, metro, or train.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller_ny07
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for the may day bank holiday weekend 5th to 8th May, the staff were great, the rooms were clean and breakfast was fantastic. Buses 85 and 16 located 2 minutes walk away go straight into town in 15 minutes, and metro is not to far either. The only thing is that it can be a bit noisy if your room is facing the railway which runs behind the hotel when trains come past. But this should not deter you in any way, definately value for money and i would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: LondonPatrick
